1151211222213112111.title: Escape and Meetings

11512112222131121111.content:
Bill took the ones who wanted to go home back to North Rafflesia in hir TARDIS. Among these were Marcia Johnson and Alexander D’Arcy, who had been Mark Johnson and Alexis D’Arcy before they effectively swapped bodies.
Maria went with them to explain to their parents what had happened and to help the Johnsons accept that they now had a new daughter and the D’Arcys that they had a new son.

One of the first things Marcia did when she got home was to pack up all of ‘Mark’s’ clothes and beings them over to the D’Arcy home. They’d be no use to her and would now fit Alexander perfectly. While she was there, Alexander gave her what had been “Alexis’” old clothes, for similar reasons.
Marcia then set about living her new life. It was odd. It certainly felt strange having a girl’s body, but somehow not “wrong”. She felt no trace of the dysphoria Cal – except that she was Barbara now, had to remember that - had described feeling as a trans woman. Instead, it was like moving into a new room, or wearing a new set of clothes, unfamiliar now, but which she knew she’d eventually get used to.
Perhaps it was a side effect of Jamie’s magic. If so, it was a mercy, because Marcia had so many other things to adjust to. One thing was that all of her relationships – inside her family and outside – had to be severely “readjusted”. Her parents and younger sister adjusted reasonably well, all things considered, realizing and more or less accepting that Marcia was the same person they had known as “Mark”.
Extended family members, neighbors and friends often had more difficulty. Everyone had heard what had happened – or at least a version of it – but not everyone believed it. Some people even thought that the Johnsons and the D’Arcys had traded children!
As for Mark’s and Alexis’ friends – some of them expected Marcia to be Alexis and Alexis to be Marcia. Fortunately, you had each other – although they each had to admit that it was a bit weird kissing someone who had their old face! Each of them helped the other as Alexander learned how to be a boy and Marcia learned how to be a girl.

Maria had ensured that the government provided free counseling to all the transformed people, and Marcia had taken advantage of it. She was still coping with living her new life when she encountered one of the delayed “surprises” that Jamie had mentioned.

Finally, she had to deal with being somewhat famous. It wasn’t too bad. While their transformations had been drastic enough, some of the others had been changed even more drastically, and so they didn’t get as much attention as some of the others.
11512112222131121111.title: Marcia's Next Life

115121122221311211111.content:
One Saturday morning about a month after her transformation, Marcia was showering, thinking as she frequently did about how often Mark had fantasized about seeing Alexis’ body naked and wet. He’d never guessed that he’d end up wearing her body and seeing naked and wet every day! This led to her wondering if Alexander felt the same way. This in turn led to her imagining Alexander naked and wet, which led to her getting a little worked up. The fact that she was getting worked up over her old body weirded her out a bit.

When she was through showering, she went to her room to begin getting dressed. She was joined by her little sister, Elizabeth, who would often come to visit her first thing in the morning and chat, often offering advice about how Marcia should wear her hair, some of it even useful. Elizabeth was an early riser, and even on a Saturday had been up for hours.
Elizabeth was thirteen years old and would be starting eighth grade in the fall. She was short (4’8”) and flat-chested and somewhat insecure about her looks. Marcia thought this was a shame, because it was obvious to her that her little sister would be quite pretty in a few years.

As Marcia dressed, Elizabeth looked at her and said, “It’s not fair!”

“What’s not fair?”, asked Marcia.

“It’s not fair that my brother ended up being cuter than me! I wish I was as pretty as you are!”

“Oh, Liz, just give it time!”, said Marcia.

“Easy for you to say!”, said Elizabeth. “I…uh…I feel weird…”

“What’s the matter?”, asked Marcia.

“My clothes feel so tight”, said Elizabeth. “I…um…I…”

As Marcia watched, her sister started to grow. She got taller and her figure began to rapidly develop, her virtually nonexistent breasts swelling so quickly that they demolished the training bra that she had worn more out of hope than necessity. Her shirt buttons all burst and her jeans split up the back. Her face began to change as well, becoming one that was all too familiar to Marcia – it was her own! When the transformation was complete, Elizabeth had become Marcia’s physical twin!

Elizabeth noticed Marcia staring at her. “What is it?” then, beginning to notice the changes in her body. “What happened to me? Why does my voice sound so funny?”

Wordlessly, Marcia guided Elizabeth over to her mirror. Liz gasped at what she saw. “I-I’m you! How? Why?”

“I think it’s one of those little ‘surprises’ Jamie talked about”, said Marcia. “You wished you were as pretty as I am. Well, now you’re exactly as pretty as I am.”

“Oh, my God”, said Elizabeth, running her hands over her new body. “I wanted to be pretty like you are, I didn’t want to be your twin! What am I gonna do?”

“Well, first thing, let’s get you into some of my clothes, and then we’d better go tell Mom and Dad.” Marcia sighed, “As if my life wasn’t weird enough.”

And so, Marcia had to get used to having a twin little sister. It was a shame, she thought. Liz should have had a chance to grow up and become who she’d been meant to be. Of course, I suppose I did, too, Damn it, Jamie, why did you have to do this to us?

About the only positive out of it was their discovery that Alexander could always tell them apart, even when they tried to fool him. It soon became easier, as Liz quickly developed an almost manic determination to have her own “look”, as different from Marcia’s as possible.

When she had the time, Marcia took note of things going on outside her own family. From time to time, she met some of the other transformees, and learned of the “surprises” one or two of them had encountered, and of the “surprises” that had occurred to various people in town. In particular, several people in town, apparently unconnected to one another, had transformed into Pokémon and winged monkeys, all of whom were taken into custody by Maria, or Meryet-Ra, as she had taken to calling herself.

Marcia noticed how much the authorities cooperated with the Pharaoh.

If I was of a suspicious nature, thought Marcia, I might wonder if the great Meryet-Ra had been using her magical powers to “grease the wheels”, so to speak. Well, nothing I can do about it even if she is.

One day, three months after her transformation, Marcia received an unexpected invitation…
115121122221311211111.title: A Twin Little Sister

1151211222213112111111.content:
Marcia read the invitation. It was a hand-written note from Meryet-Ra inviting her to a gathering of the original transformees at her new estate in Colorado, with the necessary transportation provided. She talked it over with her parents and with their permission she decided to go, especially after learning that Alexander had decided to go as well. When the day came, she packed the overnight bag that the invitation had recommended and left her house.

Parked out front was a vehicle that looked like a cross between a stagecoach and a limousine. A young, dark-haired woman dressed in an elaborate uniform stood next to it. She smiled and held out her hand when she saw Marcia.

As Marcia shook her hand, the woman said, “Hi, I’m Emiko, I work for Meryet-Ra.”

“Pleased to meet you”, said Marcia, as Emiko helped her into the coach. Emiko climbed into the driver’s seat and began to drive down the street. People came out to watch it as it passed, and Marcia had to fight an urge to wave at them as though she were the Queen or the Pope or something.

Emiko drove them out of town, eventually turning on to a side road that Marcia was reasonably certain hadn’t been there before. This led to a tunnel that Marcia knew for sure hadn’t been there before. It was large – far larger than any tunnel she’d ever seen, and well lit. The walls were painted cheerful, nonthreatening colors. After a fifteen-minute ride, they emerged onto a mountain road which led to a walled estate. The wall was decorated with Egyptian hieroglyphics. An ornate gate opened automatically as the coach approached. They pulled up in front of a modest mansion – “modest” in the sense that Marcia’s family’s house would only have fit into it ten times. As Emiko helped her out of the car, Marcia breathed in the fresh mountain air. They were obviously somewhere in the Rockies. So, this was the Pharaoh’s magic!

“Hey, Emiko”, she said, “How long has that tunnel been there?”

“Oh, that tunnel is wherever the Pharaoh wants it to be. She could have teleported you here, but some people find that a bit disconcerting, so she sent us out to pick you up.”

“How many drivers does she have?”, asked Marcia.

“As many as she needs”, came Emiko’s reply.

Emiko took her leave of Marcia and drove off. Marcia turned and approached the front door, which was opened by a young man in a butler’s uniform. He was tall, with long blonde hair tied back in a ponytail.

What a beautiful boy!, she thought, before guiltily thinking of Alex.

“Ah, Lady Marcia”, he said, in a purring voice. “How good of you to come. My name is Wilson. Please allow me to greet you of behalf of Lady Meryet-Ra. She apologizes for not greeting you personally, but she is still making some last-minute preparations. If you will follow me, I will show you to your room.”

It was only then that Marcia noticed Wilson’s lack of an Adam’s Apple, and the ever-so-slight curves of “his” hips and chest. Wilson was a girl! (Albeit a handsome, somewhat androgynous one.) She took Marcia’s bag and led her into a main hall that was much larger than it should have been, even given the size of the mansion. Wilson then led her to an elevator that took her to the third floor, then showed her to her room, giving her the key before telling to call if she needed anything.

“There will be a gathering for luncheon”, she said, bowing. “Until then, please make yourself at home.”

Marcia turned to look at her room. It was about three times the size of her room at home and decorated luxuriantly but tastefully. There was a large, comfortable-looking bed, a desk with a computer and an old-style telephone on it, a make-up table, a full-length mirror and a large dresser. At one end of the room was an entertainment system with audio equipment and a big screen TV, and a large couch, next to which was a mini-fridge which proved to be stocked with her favorite non-alcoholic drinks. It was exactly how she would have furnished a room herself if she’d had the money. There were even pictures of her with Alexander and her with her parents and Elizabeth on the walls.

At the other end of the room was a kitchenette with a full-size fridge, stove and microwave, and cabinets stocked with her favorite foods. (As was the fridge.)

Marcia found a walk-in closet filled with a wide range of clothing, all of which were the sort of things she would have picked out for herself.

Further exploration led her to the biggest bathroom she’d ever seen with a huge shower and a bathtub that could have seated five. The medicine chest was well-stocked with a variety of items, including, she noted, condoms. Apparently, Meryet-Ra was planning for a number of eventualities.

After that, she found a doorway leading to a balcony from which she had a breathtaking view of the Rockies.

She went back out and sat on the bed. A clock on the nightstand said that it was 8:45 a.m. It had been 10:00 a.m. Eastern when she’d left the house. The drive here had taken 15 minutes, and she’d taken another fifteen to explore the room, so it ought to be 10:45. It took her a minute to remember that she was on Mountain time, so the clock was right after all. This meant that there was a fair amount of time until lunch. What should she do?

She could just stay in her room and relax, or go explore the mansion, or go see who else had arrived.

1151211222213112111111311.content:
It was Camilla (née Paula) Ortiz. She was wearing a tee shirt, jeans and sneakers, but still managed to look elegant.

“Hi, Camiila!”, said Marcia.

Spotting Marcia, Camilla jumped up and grabbed her in a bearhug, burying Marcia’s head between her mammoth breasts.

“Marcia, darling, how wonderful to see you!”, said Camilla.

“Mmmph, mmmph!”, said Marcia.

“Oh, sorry, sweetie”, said Camilla, releasing her. “It’s this wretched spell of Jamie’s. It overwrote my personality to be like Camilla in the game. I still remember being Paula, but it’s like I’ve been made over into someone else. It’s really been quite distressing. But, come on, darling, let’s sit down.”

Camilla led them over to some chairs, and they sat down.

“So, tell me, sweetie, how have you been?”, she asked.

“OK, I guess”, said Marcia. “You heard about what happened to my sister Elizabeth?”

“Yes, dear”, said Camilla. “It must have been quite unpleasant.”

“Yeah, it’s been an adjustment”, said Marcia. “How’s it been for you? I heard you caught one of Jamie’s little surprises, too?”

“You could say that, dear”, said Camilla. “It was bad enough being turned into someone else, but suddenly finding myself in a new body pretty much killed my - that is, Paula’s -hopes of a gymnastics career. I’m not exactly built for it, you know. It was even harder on poor Hinoka, of course. Not just becoming a girl – you know what that’s like - but Benny had dreams of the NFL, you know, and from what his coach said, he’d had a real chance at it. All gone, just like that.”

She paused and took some needlepoint out of a bag that Marcia hadn’t noticed before and began sewing.

“I’m always sewing these days”, she said. “I’ll sew something for you, dear. No, don’t object, I just seem to sew whether I really want to or not. It’s just part of who I am now.”

She sighed before continuing. “Anyway, we had to deal with the publicity – as we all did – as well as the scientists who wanted to examine my wyvern and Hinoka’s pegasus, plus those darling creatures need to be fed and cared for. So, we cut a deal with the nice people who own the Fire emblem games to do publicity for them. Tedious, of course, but the money comes in handy.”

“Hinoka and I had taken to spending a lot of time together, flying around. It was so good to get away from it all. Then one morning, we were all eating breakfast together - our parents, me, Hinoka, and our little brother and sister – when our little ‘surprise’ happened.”

The “little brother and sister” were Pedro (aged 14 and known as “Petey”) and Rosalia (aged 12 and known as “Rosie”). Petey was the typical sullen teenage boy, whereas Rosie was loud, friendly and outgoing.

“Rosie was needling Petey, as usual. ‘Well, I got one brother upgraded, I wish we could upgrade you, Petey, and we could all be princesses together”, she said.

Before Petey could come up with a witty riposte, they both began to change. Rosie became a demure-looking, slight-framed girl with her hair in a red bob, and Petey became a perky-looking little blonde girl with improbably long curled ponytails. In other words, they became the characters Sakura and Elise from the same game as Camilla and Hinoka.”

“I bet your parents freaked out”, said Marcia.

“To say the least”, said Camiila. “And of course, Petey was outraged. We soon discovered that Elise had come with a horse. She was Strategist class which meant she could do healing magic and had a tome of her own, as well. Sakura was Priestess so she could do healing magic, too, as well as now being an expert archer.”

“’Class’?”, asked Marcia.

“It’s part of the game. I’m Malig Knight class and Hinoka’s Falcon Knight class. It doesn’t matter. It was sad, watching over the next few days as the spell overwrote their personalities - Rosie becoming the timid introvert Sakura and Petey becoming the bubbly and extroverted Elise. For all their flaws, I liked them the way they were.”

As they chatted, a maid appeared as if from nowhere, pushing a tea trolley. The two friends accepted some tea and a plate of pastries. They continued conversing as the maid apparently vanished into the woodwork.

After a while, they noticed someone coming down the hall towards them.

It was...

11512112222131121111113111.content:
Soon Camilla and Marcia noticed that the person was Prunuspersica, who had been Bobby Dalton, but was now an amalgamation of the Borg Queen and Princess Peach of the Mushroom Kingdom. She held up a hand as Camilla got up, apparently intending to hug her.

“Sorry”, Prunuspersica said, “I don’t mean to seem antisocial, but it’s best if I don’t touch you. My control is getting better, but for now I’m keeping my distance from people for the moment. I don’t need any more trouble just now. I suppose you’ve heard what happened?”

“Not really, sweetie”, said Camilla. “There’ve been rumors about, but nothing concrete.”

Prunuspersica sighed. “It started about a week after the party. My older sister Karen and my younger sister Bridget, were teasing me about being turned into a ‘robot girl’, as they put it. They were poking at me, asking if my ‘robo-boobs’ were real. I got fed up and went to brush them away. When I touched them, these tubes came out of my arms and I – I assimilated them. I swear it wasn’t deliberate – it just sort of…happened. It was the weirdest thing I’ve ever experienced. I felt their minds flowing into mine – everything they were became a part of me. I knew them better than I’d ever known anyone. I knew things about them that I’d rather have never known. We became a collective.”

“How terrible for you, darling!”, said Camilla.

“Your parents must have gone ballistic”, said Marcia.

“They did, but It gets worse”, said Prunuspersica. “Karen’s boyfriend Danny insisted on seeing her. He grabbed her hand, trying to ‘snap her out of it’, and she assimilated him, and he became part of my collective. Naturally, his parents went nuts. A few days later, Bridget’s best friend Violet came up and grabbed me by the arm, practically pulling it out of its socket. It startled me and I assimilated her.”

She paused and looked out the windows for a moment.

“Once she was part of me, I realized why she’d done it. Apparently, her father had been…well…doing things to her…for years. Her mother didn’t believe her – or maybe wouldn’t believe her. Anyway, her home life was so bad, she preferred to be one of my drones. At least that way, she’d be with Bridget and safe from…him.”

“What happened next?”, asked Marcia.

“Oh, Meryet-Ra helped us smooth things over with Danny’s family. As for Violet’s parents, they disappeared. Took off, or so the police figure. The next morning, the father’s car was gone, their bank accounts were cleaned out and most of their clothes were gone. There’s an APB out, but no one’s seen hide nor hair of them since. Anyway, I…we…my collective lives here now.”

Really? Wow”, said Marcia.

“Yeah”, said Prunuspersica. “Meryet-Ra gave us our own section of the palace to live in. As I’m sure you’ve noticed, this place is bigger on the inside, just like Bill’s TARDIS.”

“Speaking of which, has anyone seen Bill?”, asked Marcia.

“Bill and Phoebe took off in the TARDIS shortly after the party. No one’s seen them since”, said Prunuspersica. “Although I gather they were over in Britain last month, letting the BBC do some publicity shots or something. After that, nothing. Meryet-Ra has assured me they will be here.”

“Have either of you seen any of the others?”, asked Marcia.

“Well, I came with Hinoka, of course”, said Camilla. “Apart from that, I haven’t seen anyone else.”

“I ran into Link and Zelda earlier. They were going exploring”, said Prunuspersica. “Oh, and Ophelia, but she lives here now, too.”

“Oh, yes?”, asked Marcia.

“Yeah”, Prunuspersica replied. “I gather her family couldn’t handle having their daughter turn into a zombie. So, Meryet-Ra worked it out with her family for her to come and live here.”

“Marcia darling, where’s that young man of yours?”, asked Camilla. “I’m surprised you didn’t come down together.”

“No, we didn’t”, said Marcia. “I was going to try looking for him, but then I got caught up talking to you two. Actually, I don’t know where to start looking for him.”

“Hang on”, said Prunuspersica. “I’m linked to the palace’s computer system. I can tell you where he should be.”

After sitting perfectly still for a few seconds, she said. “Actually, Alexander’s in the room right next to yours, Marcia, one door to the left. Or at least, that’s the room the Pharaoh assigned to him. I’m surprised you didn’t see him coming in.”

“We must have just missed each other”, said Marcia. “If you two ladies will excuse me, I think I’ll go see if he’s in his room.”

“Of course, darling”, said Camilla. “When you find him, give him a hug for me!”
11512112222131121111113111.title: The Princess of the Mushroom Borg

115121122221311211111131111.content:
Marcia walked back towards her room. She knocked on the door of the room one to the left of hers. Eventually, she heard a sleepy “Hello?”

“Alex?”, said Marcia. “It’s me, babe.”

“Hang on”, he said. A few seconds later, he opened the door, smiling when he saw her. He was wearing a white shirt and blue jeans.

“Hi, hon”, he said, leaning down to kiss her. C’mon in.”

Marcia followed him into his room. It was similar to hers, and like hers was decorated about the way she figured Alex would have furnished his room if he’d had unlimited funding.

“How long have you been here?”, she asked.

“I got in around 9:00 local time”, he replied.

“We must have just missed each other”, she said. “I got in just before that.”

“I guess”, said Alex. “I looked around the room a bit, then I stretched out on the bed to see if it was as comfortable as it looked, and it was. I dozed right off.”

“I looked around my room a bit”, said Marcia. “Then went looking around and ran in to Camilla and Prunuspersica and talked to them a bit.”

“Oh, yeah?”, said Alex. “How are they?”

“Let’s go out on your balcony and talk”, said Marcia. They went and sat on an ornate bench on Alex’s balcony. They sat quietly for a moment, taking in the view. A Flying-Type Pokémon, a Fearow, flew by, circling as if looking for something.
Finally, it made a beeline for something it had spotted on the ground. It vanished out of sight before they could see what it was hunting and whether it caught it. It occurred to Marcia that all of the Pokémon were transformed humans. Could the Fearow have been hunting another Pokémon? Surely Meryet-Ra wouldn’t allow that!

Marcia and Alexander chatted for a while. She filled him in on what she’d learned about Camilla and Prunuspersica, while he talked about his ride there. He’d been amused by the butler Wilson calling him “Lord Alexander”. Marcia had been amused to discover that Alex hadn’t noticed that Wilson was a woman. Eventually they talked about more inconsequential things, like school and family gossip.

Alex’s transition from Alexis to Alexander had been somewhat easier than Marcia’s. Her relationship with her father seemed to have improved, once the initial shock had started to pass.

“Dad never really ‘got’ having a daughter”, he’d said. “We ‘relate’ better, now.”

The pair of them sat together for a while until Marcia noticed that it was 11:30.

“I guess we oughta find out where this ‘luncheon’ is gonna be”, she said.

As if on cue, they heard Alex’s phone ring. He went in and answered it. It was Wilson the butler.

“Just a reminder, Lord Alexander, that luncheon is at noon on the patio. Simply use the elevator and press ‘G’ for the ground floor. There will be servants who will guide you to the outdoor dining area. Dress will be informal.”

Deciding there was no harm in being early, Marcia and Alex left his room, went to the elevator and took it to the ground floor. When they exited the elevator, the first person they saw was Barbara Newborn – who had been Cal Powell. Marcia remembered what Barbara had told her when they’d met a month after the transformations.

“My dad refused to acknowledge me as his kid, wouldn’t even let me in the house. Mom wouldn’t stand up to him, of course. Meryet-Ra set up a new identity for me. I kept the ‘Barbara’, but dropped the ‘Gordon’ – I didn’t want DC Comics’ lawyers after me, ha-ha. Anyway, I’m working as a librarian over in New Koenigsberg now.”

Today she seemed happy and energetic.

“Hey, lovebirds!”, she said when she saw Marcia and Alex.

The trio chatted as they walked towards the rear of the palace. Barbara seemed to know the way so there was no need to speak to any of the numerous servants whom they saw busy at their tasks. Eventually they existed the rear of the building and found themselves on a large open patio with an amazing view of the mountains in the distance. There was a large semi-circular table, so positioned that anyone sitting at it would be able to see anyone else at the table and also have a good view of the scenery.

Most of the other transformees were there, even the four Pokémon who had been Jimmy Davis (Mimikyu), Paul McArdle (Banette), Andy Young (Froslass) and Joey Dubois (Trevenant) and the winged monkeys who had been Steve Peters and Morgan Francis. Morgan was obviously pregnant.

Steve and Morgan came over to Marcia, chittering happily when they saw her. They’d been good friends of Mark’s and some vestige of that remained in what was left of their minds. Marcia spoke to them amiably, they way one might to animals that one might reasonably hope were friendly. It was hard for her to see them like this, and she did not stay with them long.

The next person they saw was Ophelia Voorhees (née Anne Ogawa), who merely nodded at them and waved.

“She can still talk, but she doesn’t much, these days”, said Barbara. “Oh, there’s Mr. O’Donnell!”

Matthew (now Grandfather Clock) was being rolled in on a two-wheeler by two servants. Marcia, Alex and Barbara stopped to talk to him.

“Your wife isn’t with you, sir?”, asked Barbara.

“No”, he said. “She’s up in our room. For whatever reason, she wanted this first luncheon to be just for those of us that were at the party.”

They all had heard of how Sheila O’Donnell had received one of Jamie’s little “surprises”. She’d had trouble adjusting to Matthew’s transformation, and had said, “Oh, Matthew, I wish I could really understand what’s happened to you!”, only to find herself transforming into Grandmother Clock. Now, the pair shared a room together in Meryet-Ra’s palace, with a voice-activated entertainment system and personal servants to meet any other needs they might have. Perhaps fortunately, the pair had no children.

The next people that Alex and Marcia ran into were Link and Zelda, who had been Jenny Swenson and Anita Crawford. If there had been a question as to whether or not Jenny and Anita had been a couple, there seemed to be no such question about Link and Zelda, as they came in arm-in-arm in much the way that Marcia and Alex had.

Marcia hadn’t seen either of them in a while. Link, too, had had an encounter with one of Jamie’s post-party “surprises”. There had been some kind of an incident, but it had been hushed up, mostly, and Link and Zelda had dropped out of sight afterwards.

“Hey, Link, long time no see”, said Marcia. “Where’ve you been?”

“Oh, hi, Marcia”, said Link. “Zelda and I are living here, now. I suppose you head what happened?”

“Not really”, said Marcia. “I heard that something happened, but no details.”

“Oh”, said Link. “Well here’s what happened…”

After the party, Link had returned to the Swenson home, and tried to get on with his new life. The Swensons tried their best to deal with it, but it wasn’t easy. Link’s fifteen year-old younger sister, Andrea, in many ways a typical middle child, had resented all the attention that Link was getting. Their ten year-old sister, Virginia (known as Ginny), on the other hand, thought it was great.

One Saturday afternoon, Andrea was hanging out at home with three of her friends:
• Faith Duncan, whose parents were fairly strict religious fundamentalists. She had taken a long time to come out of her shell.
• Tiffany Donne-Forbes, a girl from a rich family, she was something of a wild child, and had gotten kicked out of the elite girls’ school she’d been attending, which was why she’d been enrolled in the local public high school where she met Andrea.
• Alana Hamilton, a small, thin, studious Black girl who regularly got the highest grades in their class with an ease that aroused jealousy in many of her more academically-challenged classmates.
The four girls had gotten roped into watching Ginny while Mrs. Swenson went shopping. They were playing Super Smash Brothers Ultimate with Ginny when Link had returned from a Nintendo publicity shoot. Zelda had come with him, since she’d been at the shoot as well.

Andrea had rolled her eyes when she saw them come in, still in full costume.

“Oh, look”, she said. “It’s my sister – sorry, ‘brother’ – who became a media sensation because a sorceress turned her into a video game character!”

“Aw, you’re just jealous, Andi”, said Ginny. “I wish we all could be video game characters!”

Link and Zelda watched in shock as the five girls were transformed into the characters they had been playing in the game:
• Andrea had become King Dedede, a man-sized rotund penguin, wearing royal robes and carrying an improbably large mallet.
• Ginny had become Isabelle, a cute little anthropomorphic dog.
• Faith had become Bayonetta, a sexy, bespectacled, gun-toting witch.
• Tiffany had become Bowser, an extremely large, fire-breathing turtle.
• Alana had become Captain Falcon, a tall, muscular – and white male – bounty hunter.
Needless to say, there’d been a huge stink with their own families and those of the other girls. Meryet-Ra had intervened and the girls were now living with her.

Jenny’s story was interrupted by a wheezing, groaning sound as Bill’s TARDIS materialized. Phoebe and Bill came out. Bill was obviously pregnant – more than three, more like six – and wearing a “maternity” version on the Thirteenth Doctor’s costume.

“So, they’re here”, said Link. “Everyone’s here but the triplets and the Pharaoh herself. I suppose ‘luncheon’ will be starting soon. We can talk more later.”
115121122221311211111131111.title: Alex is in his room

1151211222213112111111311111.content:
Link, Zelda, Marcia and Alex joined the others in rushing over to talk to Bill and Phoebe.

“To answer the question you are all thinking of asking”, Phoebe was saying, “I am the ‘fatherrrr’.”

“It’s only been three months, Bill, darling”, said Camilla. “But you look six months pregnant.”

“We’ve been doing a lot of time traveling”, said Bill.

Just then, a shadow passed over them. They all looked up and saw Queen Ghidorah flying overhead. They landed a safe distance away and sprawled so that her heads were resting in front of the table.

“Hello, my friends”, they said. “The Pharaoh has cast a translation spell so we may converse.”

As if by unspoken agreement, they all went to sit at the table, finding their places as if by instinct. Marica ended up between Alex and Barbara. She noticed that there was a separate smaller table for Steve and Morgan and the four Pokémon, where they were being attended by Meryet-Ra’s servants.

As they seated themselves, they heard Meryet-Ra’s voice: “Thank you all for coming, it’s good to see you all again. Please consider my home as your home. You’re all always welcome here, stay as long as you like. Don’t worry about staying too long. Time passes differently in this realm of mine. For now, let’s enjoy lunch and catch up with each other.”

She sat at the head of the table, dressed like Cleopatra on her day off.

Numerous servants brought out the food. Marcia noticed that no matter whether they were uniformed as maids, butlers or footmen, all of Meryet-Ra’s servants were female. She wondered what reason there might be behind that but was a little afraid to ask.

The food was good, and soon everyone was eating happily. Well, almost everyone - Grandfather Clock, Ophelia Voorhees and Queen Ghidorah were not. It made sense that a clock and a zombie wouldn’t eat, but she did wonder what – if anything – the triplets would eat.

As if she’d read Marcia’s mind, Camilla spoke up and said:

“Ghidorah, darlings, aren’t you eating? What do you eat, dears?”

Ghidorah replied, “We consume life force, as all living things do in their way, though we do it somewhat more directly than most.”

“Oh, that reminds me, dear” said Bill. “We’ve been doing a lot of exploring around this galaxy. We’ve found a number of worlds with life but no intelligent beings, enough to keep you fed for thousands of years. I’ll give you the info after lunch.”

“Thank you, Bill” they replied. “I am grateful.”

When lunch was winding down, Meryet-Ra addressed them all.

“I thank you all again for coming. There will be a formal reception this evening, including dinner and a ball. I wanted this initial luncheon to be just those of us who were at Jamie’s party, but there will be additional guests this evening. The servants will be at your disposal for any necessary preparations. I apologize for being busier than I would like, but I will make of point of speaking to you all individually before you leave. Meanwhile, please feel free to explore the palace and the grounds. As most of you already know, the palace is dimensionally transcendant and the grounds are located in what you might call a ‘pocket dimension’. It may look like we’re in Colorado, but we’re not, really. Go wherever you like, there is nothing here that can harm you. My servants will help you with anything you need. I’ll see you all this evening.”
1151211222213112111111311111.title: Luncheon

11512112222131121111113111111.content:
Marcia, Barbara, Camilla, Hinoka and Barbara decided to explore the grounds together. Summoning a servant, Camilla procured some packs of water and snacks for them to carry of their perambulations. Marcia couldn’t help but smirk at the way Camilla effortlessly acted the princess.

They five of them set out through the gardens at the back of the palace and into the untamed hills beyond. As they walked, they saw a troop of winged monkeys flying overhead, as well as numerous types of Pokémon.

“Is it me or are there a lot of different Pokémon here?”, said Marcia. “It’s seems as though there’s a lot than I’d heard about.”

“It’s possible that more people fell victim to Jamie’s little ‘surprises’ than we’ve been told”, said Barbara. “I’ve heard rumors about people disappearing. It’s possible that there’s been a cover-up to keep people from freaking out.”

“It’s also possible that they’ve been breeding”, said Zelda. “Meryet-Ra did say that time flows differently here.” They walked for quite some time, chatting amiably, until Zelda said suddenly:

“Are those centaurs over there?”

The other four looked where she was pointing. Sure enough, they saw what looked like some centaurs off in the distance. It was hard to tell, but they looked to be all female.

“It looks like it, doesn’t it”, said Hinoka. “I hadn’t heard about anyone being transformed into a centaur.”

“Me either”, said Marcia. “I guess a lotta things have gone on that we don’t know about.”

After a while, they came to a lake with a large, flat rock next to it.

“This looks like a good place to sit for a while”, said Zelda.

“That’s a good idea”, said Barbara. “It’s a very pretty spot.”

The quintet sat down and began to eat their snacks and talked over what they’d seen. They’d been there for about twenty minutes when they heard a laughing, melodic voice from behind them.

“Good afternoon! Are you new staff here?”
11512112222131121111113111111.title: Going for a Walk

115121122221311211111131111111.content:
The five friends turned and saw a young woman who was standing waist-deep in the lake. She had long red hair which was dripping wet and clinging to her otherwise naked (or at least, topless) body, plentiful freckles and sparkling green eyes.

“No, darling, we’re here as guests of Meryet-Ra”, said Camilla.

“Oh, of course!” said the swimmer. “You’re the people who were transformed when she was! I’m so sorry! My name’s Bridget, I work for the Pharaoh.”

“Won’t you join us for a few minutes, Bridget, dear?”, said Camilla, patting the rock next to her.

“I’m sorry”, said Bridget. “I’m afraid I can’t.”

“Why ever not, dear?”, asked Camilla. “Are you on duty?”

“Oh, no”, said Bridget. “It’s actually my day off. I meant that I literally can’t join you. Watch.”

Bridget dove under water and reemerged some distance away, leaping out of the water and revealing that she was a fish from the waist down – in other words, a mermaid. Laughing, she swam back over to the quintet of bipeds.

“Ah, I see”, said Camilla.

“We hadn’t heard of anyone being turned into a mermaid”, said Barbara. “I gather you caught one of Jamie’s little ‘surprises.’”

“I don’t think so, ma’am”, said Bridget. “I don’t know who Jamie is.”

“Well, if you’ll pardon an intrusive question”, said Barbara. “How did you become a mermaid?”

“The Pharaoh recruited me”, said Bridget.

“She recruited you to be a mermaid?”, asked Marcia.

“Well, she recruited me – and the other mermaids – to look after the waterways. Just like the centaurs look after the land, and the harpies look after the trees, and so on.”

“Oh”, said Barbara, “I hadn’t heard that she’d been ‘recruiting’”, said Barbara.

“Oh, yes”, said Bridget. “She’s being doing it discreetly. She approaches women she thinks are suitable and lets them know what would be expected of them.”

“I’ve noticed that all of her servants seen to be women”, said Marcia.

Bridget looked a little downcast, and said, “Most of us come from what you might call ‘difficult’ situations”, she said.

“Ah”, said Marcia, sensing that it would be best not to pursue the subject.”

Picking up on this, Barbara said, “And you didn’t mind becoming a mermaid?”

“Well, it was weird at first”, said Bridget, “But I soon got used to it. Now, I can’t imagine going back to the way I was.”

“Do you live in the lake?”, asked Hinoka.

“Yes”, said Bridget. “I have a lovely home underwater. Won’t you come and see it? Don’t worry, it’s not far, and I’ve got a room for air-breathers – it’s where I keep my electronics and other things that aren’t water-proof.”
115121122221311211111131111111.title: A new friend

1151211222213112111111311111111.content:
Marcia, Hinoka, Barbara and Zelda all looked at Camilla – somehow, she had become their “leader” – who smiled and said:

“Why thank you, darling”, she said. “We’d be delighted.”

Having said that, Camilla began stripping off her clothes. Shrugging, the other four followed suit. Marcia felt distinctly inferior to the physiques of the other four, with an especial twinge of envy at the sight of Camilla’s unfettered “flotation devices”.

“Will our clothes be safe if we leave them here?”, asked Marcia.

“Oh, yes”, said Bridget. “They’ll be fine. The Pokémon won’t touch anything belonging to a human.”

“Alright, then”, said Marcia, opting to go with the low,

“Great! Follow me”, said Bridget.

The five friends dove into the water and followed Bridget, soon coming to a hatch with two windows on either side. They followed Bridget into her home, and she led them to an inner air-filled room. It was furnished like a luxurious living room, albeit one with a full bathtub in one corner. Bridget smoothly leapt into the tub, and said:

“This is my guest area. There’s a bathroom and kitchenette, and a bed for people who stay overnight. There’s some towels in the closet there.”

Camilla took out some towels and distributed them to her friends, who began toweling themselves off.

“Sorry, I can’t give you the grand tour”, said Bridget, “But it might test your ability to hold your breath.”

Once they were dry enough, the five air-breathers sat down.

“Bridget, how long can you breathe air?”, asked Barbara.

“I can breathe air for quite a while”, said Bridget. “But I dry out pretty quickly if I stay out of the water too long.”

“How do you keep this room so neat?”, asked Marcia. “I’d think it would be hard for you to clean it.”

“Oh, I don’t”, said Bridget. “I mean, I clean my own living space, but there’s a cleaning woman who comes through once a week in scuba gear and cleans all the mermaids’ air rooms.”

“Do you ever feel constricted?”, asked Marcia. “I mean, being stuck in the water all the time?”

“Oh, no”, said Bridget. “There’s waterways all through the estate, and lots of underground channels, so we can get almost anywhere on the grounds. So, I’m no more restricted than you are.”

“Do you ever leave the grounds?”, asked Zelda. “Do you ever go to see the outside world?”

“No”, said Bridget. “If I really wanted to, I’m sure the Pharaoh would let me, but I’m content with my life here. I keep track of the outside world” – she pointed to a large television at the far end of the room – “but I have no desire to go back there.”

They continued chatting pleasantly for some time, until Barbara noticed that it was nearly 3:00 p.m.

“Sorry to have to rush out, Bridget”, she said, “but if we’re going to get back to the castle in time to get ready for dinner, we’d better head out now.”

“I quite understand”, said Bridget. “If you look in the bottom of the closet, there are some towels in waterproof bags, so you can dry yourselves off once you get back to land.”

Thanking their hostess, the five friends swam out of her home and back to sure. She accompanied them to the water’s edge. Seeing that their clothes were where they had left them, they toweled themselves off and began getting dressed.

“It’s been so nice meeting you all”, said Bridget. “Please do come back anytime.”

“Oh, we will, darling”, leaning over and giving Bridget an enthusiastic kiss, leaving the mermaid somewhat dazed.

As they walked back to the palace, they discussed their new friend.

“Such a lovely girl”, said Camilla.

“Yeah, she was nice”, said Marcia. “I wonder how many other people Meryet-Ra has recruited.”

As it happened, when they got back to the palace, Meryet-Ra was outside, almost as it they’d been waiting for them.

“Hello, my ladies”, she said, “Been exploring?”

“Yes, Your Majesty”, said Camilla. “The grounds are quite beautiful, and we met a charming young mermaid.”

“Oh, yes?”, said Meryet-Ra. “Was it Bridget, by any chance?”

“That’s right”, said Camilla. “A lovely girl. We could have stayed much longer, but we needed to get ready for this evening.”
“Ah, yes”, said Meryet-Ra. “Good thinking. Don’t worry, there will be servants to help you prepare.”

She pulled the Ortiz sisters aside. “Camilla, Hinoka, I wonder if I might have a moment of Your Highnesses’ time?”

She turned to the other three, smiled at them, and said, “I’ll see you ladies this evening”, in an obvious dismissal.
1151211222213112111111311111111.title: Visiting a Mermaid

11512112222131121111113111111111.content:
Marcia, Barbara and Zelda returned to their rooms, agreeing to meet up together before going down to dinner.

When Marcia got to her room, she found two maids – one apparently of East Asian ancestry (Marcia would have guessed Korean) and the other a redhead with a strong Scottish accent.

“Hello, My Lady”, the Asian one said. “I’m Julie and this is Agnes. We’re here to help you get ready for the reception this evening.”

“OK”, said Marcia.

And so, Marcia learned what it was like to be pampered. After she showered, Julie and Agnes took over, doing her hair and make-up, helping her choose what to wear, and dressing her.

When they were done, she looked at herself in the mirror, and gasped in awe - she was gorgeous! Her hair was swept up in a style she’d never worn before, and was wearing a beautiful blue floor-length dress, complemented by jeweled tiara, necklace and earrings. She looked like a Nineteenth Century British society woman.

At that moment, there was a knock at the door. Julie went to see who it was. Then she turned to Marcia and said:
11512112222131121111113111111111.title: Next

115121122221311211111131111111111.content:
“Lady Marcia, Lady Elizabeth Johnson is here to see you.”

“What?”, said Marcia. “Liz is here? I mean, yeah, let her in.”

Liz came in, dressed as elegantly as Marcia was, only with a red dress and a different hairstyle.

“Surprise, sis!”, she said.

“What are you doing here?”, asked Marcia.

“Meryet-Ra invited me”, said Liz. “She suggested keeping it a secret – just a little gag. Say, sis, you look good.”

“You look good yourself, Liz”, said Marcia. “Well, shall we head down?”

Turning to Julie and Agnes, she said, “Thanks so much for your help, ladies.”

“Think nothing of it, My Lady”, they said, curtseying.

Liza and Marcia left Marcia’s room and went over and knocked on Alex’s door. Alex opened the door. He was wearing the most elegant suit Marcia had ever seen.

“Whoa, babe, you clean up nice”, she said.

“Easy, sis, you’re drooling”, said Liz.

“You look pretty good yourself, hon”, said Alex, kissing Marcia. “You, too, squirt.”

“Thanks, Alex”, said Liz. You look presentable, yourself. Shall we head down?”

Link and Zelda were there (both also elegantly dressed), as were a large penguin with a big hammer, and a cute bipedal dog wearing an elegant dress.
Marcia, Liz and Alex exchanged greetings and compliments.

“Allow me to introduce my little brother, King Dedede, and my little sister, Isabelle”, said Link. Marcia, in her run, introduced Liz to the others.

As they chatted, they heard a voice from behind them. “My goodness, what a striking collection of beautiful people!”

They turned to see Camilla and Hinoka coming down the hall towards them, accompanied by two girls who proved to be their sisters Elise and Sakura. Barbara was with them, as well. They exchanged greetings and compliments and then got into the elevators.

When they got to the ground floor, servants directed them to the great hall, which proved to be a huge room, half taken up by tables, and half taken up by a large dance floor. An all-woman orchestra was off to one side, playing instrumental versions of popular hits. One wall was missing - Queen Ghidorah’s heads were visible outside the building, looking in.
As they entered the hall, a footwoman announced them loudly:

“His Majesty, King Dedede!
Their Highnesses, the Princesses Camilla, Elise, Hinoka, Sakura, and Zelda!
Lords Alexander D’Arcy and Link Swenson!
Ladies Barbara Newborn, Elizabeth Johnson, Isabelle Swanson, and Marcia Johnson!”

Marcia looked round the room and saw Grandfather and Grandmother Clock, Ophelia, Prunuspersica and her four drones, Bill and Phoebe, Bayonetta Duncan, Bowser Donne-Forbes and Captain Falcon Hamilton. There was no sign of Steve and Morgan or the four Pokémon, but everyone she might have expected to be there was there, except for Meryet-Ra herself.

Probably waiting to make a big entrance, thought Marcia.

Just then, she heard someone say, “Good evening, Lady Marcia!”
115121122221311211111131111111111.title: A Surprise Guest

1151211222213112111111311111111111.content:
She turned and saw Bridget coming towards her. Bridget was in a large transparent tube filled with water. The tube was resting on a wheeled platform. There was a sort of harness in the tube enabling Bridget to rest comfortably upright. There were controls at hand level. She wore a clam shell bra and tiara, necklace and earrings.

“I suppose it’s you five I have to thank for the invitation I received an hour after you left?”, she said.

“In a way, I suppose”, said Marcia. “We ran into Meryet-Ra right after we left you and mentioned that we’d met. Just a coincidence, I guess.”

“I wonder how many coincidences actually happen around the Pharaoh”, said Bridget.
1151211222213112111111311111111111.title: Another surprise guest

11512112222131121111113111111111111.content:
Just then, the footwoman announced, “Her Majesty, the Pharaoh Meryet-Ra!”

They all turned to look at her. She wore resplendent jeweled robes and a jeweled Egyptian-style crown. She looked every inch a queen. Despite how well-dressed they all were, she outshone them all. She waved, greeting the people nearest to her.

At that moment, another voice rang out: “Dinner is served!”

They all sat down at the tables, and those of them that could eat did so. The meal was excellent. Meryet-Ra gave a brief speech, and then servants began busily bringing out food and drink - although no alcohol, Marcia noted.

After dinner, there was dancing. Marcia danced with Alex, Link, Camilla, and even Bowser and King Dedede. In between dances, she chatted with the other guests.

Queen Ghidorah remained outside, of course. She told Marcia of her plans.

“We will leave this world tomorrow, to seek out the worlds Bill told me of where I may feed, and to see the universe. We have already taken leave of my human family. I will miss our home, but it is too small for us now.”

Ophelia Voorhees was wearing a beautiful gown, and her hair was carefully styled. Her usual mask was replaced by one of gleaming silver, and her machete hung at her side in a jeweled scabbard.

“Can I ask you a personal question?”, asked Marcia.

“You can ask”, said Ophelia. “I might even answer.”

“I’ve been hanging out with Camilla and Hinoka, and they’ve both talked about how their personalities were ‘overwitten’ by the personalities of the characters they turned into – even though they still have their old memories. I was just curious -have you felt any of that?”

“Not really”, said Ophelia. “I’ve felt no desire to kill anyone – not even horny teenagers – nor am I pining away for a ‘Hamlet’. It’s true that I’m not the chatterbox I used to be, and I do like to have my machete with me, and I seem to know a lot of bawdy Elizabethan songs now, but I’m still me. Mostly I just regret my costume choice. If we’d known what was going to happen, I think that most of us – except maybe Barbara, or Meryet-Ra – would have chosen differently. Have you felt yourself turning into ‘Alexis’ - I mean, the Alexis that was?”

“No”, said Marcia. “It’s mostly just been learning to be a girl. It hasn’t been easy, but as difficult as it has been, it maybe hasn’t been as hard as it might have been.”

“I don’t know”, said Ophelia. “I don’t understand the least thing about magic, or how it works. Maybe Meryet-Ra could tell you, if she would. “

“So, you’re living here now?”, asked Marcia.

“Yeah”, Ophelia replied. “My parents tried their best, but they just couldn’t hack it. I don’t blame them. Either I creep people out, or they become obsessed with seeing what I look like under the mask, and then I creep them out.”

Marcia started to say something, then stopped.

“Sure, why not?”, said Ophelia, in response to what she assumed was Marcia’s unspoken question. She looked around and then lifted her mask.

By a heroic effort, Marcia managed not to flinch. Apart from the mottled gray skin and the blurry, lifeless eyes, there was nothing wrong with Ophelia’s face – no scars or deformities. It was the face of a pretty young woman – but it was the face of a pretty young dead woman, and that made all the difference.

Ophelia lowered her mask back on to her face.

“Camilla actually kissed me when I showed her”, she said. “So, anyway, here is where I live now. Don’t really know what I’m going to do with my life. Meryet-Ra has said I can stay here as long as I like, and she doesn’t seem to expect me to do anything. I mostly explore the grounds, occasionally scaring the crap out of the gardeners. Wow, this is the most I’ve talked in ages.”

They chatted a little more, and then Marcia went to talk to someone else...
11512112222131121111113111111111111.title: Dinner and Conversations

115121122221311211111131111111111111.content:
Bayonetta (formerly Faith) Duncan, Bowser (formerly Tiffany) Donne-Forbes and Captain Falcon (formerly Alana) Hamilton were sitting at a table together. Bayonetta and Falcon were in evening wear, while Bowser was merely wearing a bow tie.

Bowser was downing a plate of hors d’oeuvres singlehandedly when Marcia approached them and struck up a conversation, asking them the same question she’d asked Ophelia.

“It’s true for me, at least”, said Bayonetta. “My personality was overwritten. Although to tell the truth, as Faith I was so repressed, that I didn’t have much of a personality to begin with. Becoming Bayonetta was like a liberation for me. Of course, it drove my parents berserk, having their dutiful little daughter become a witch. Did you know they tried an exorcism on me? When that failed, they disowned me. I guess they were afraid I’d corrupt my little brothers and sisters. Anyway, Meryet-Ra offered me a place here. Like most of us that became video game characters, I make the odd public appearance, but that’s about it.”

“I still mostly feel like me”, said Captain Falcon, “I mean, the ‘me’ that was Alana. I don’t feel too ‘overwritten’, except for being interested in racing - which I never was before – and a tendency to say stuff like ‘Show me your moves!’ to people. My parents never really accepted that I was the same person as Alana. Not emotionally, anyway. I mean, I proved to them that I knew all sorts of things that only she could know. They sorted of accepted it on a purely intellectual level – but not deep down inside, really. It’s been weird, suddenly being white and a guy. Cops hardly even look at me twice, anymore, not even when I’m dressed in my full ‘Captain Falcon’ outfit. Also, people listen to me now. My parents never flat-out disowned me, but it just got weird at home. They were happy enough when the Pharaoh offered me a place here. My mom even comes and visits me sometimes.”

“My parents are convinced I did this deliberately”, said Bowser, “just to get back at them. It did get them off my back about being a ‘good little princess’. Heh. I told them if they wanted a little princess, I’d go kidnap one for them. I think they thought I was serious. Speaking of that, want to hear something weird? I’ve actually had offers form a few ‘princesses’ to let me ‘kidnap’ them, if you know what I mean. Not sure how I feel about that.”
She paused to inhale a tray of Vienna sausages.
“Mother and Father never actually disowned me, but they were happy enough to see me move out. The funny thing is my father helps us invest the money we’ve made from personal appearances for the video game companies. He’s most at ease when he’s dealing with numbers. So, we’ll be well off. As for what we’ll do with our lives - we still haven’t decided. We may not stay here forever. The three of us have been thinking it over.”

“Just the three of you?”, asked Marcia. “Not Dedede, too?”

“Nah”, said Bowser. “He seems content to just laze around here, live off of Meryet-Ra. Frankly, there isn’t much difference between Dedede as he is now and Andrea as she was. Bossy, lazy, likes to eat, unambitious…Not much has changed. No, he’ll stay here, and like it.”

“I think you’re being a little unfair to Dedede”, said Bayonetta. “Only a little, though. Of course, Isabelle seems to be well on her to becoming Meryet-Ra’s secretary. She seems to have become an expert administrative assistant. As for us three – we’ll have to see.”

“You three should talk to Ophelia”, said Marcia. “She’s kind of at loose ends, too.”

“Maybe we will”, said Bowser. “Maybe we will.”
115121122221311211111131111111111111.title: More Conversations

1151211222213112111111311111111111111.content:
Grandfather and Grandmother Clock were standing together at one side of the room. They had voice-controlled wheeled platforms that allowed them to move if they wished, but they seemed to prefer to stand still.
Marcia had asked them how they were dealing with their transformations.

Grandfather spoke in his oddly artificial voice: “Of course, it was a shock at first. It felt like suddenly becoming a quadriplegic. But slowly, over time. I – and later, Grandmother – found a serenity coming over us, an acceptance of what had happened to us.”

“It’s true”, said Grandmother. “The lack of physical contact was frustrating, but we’ve learned a new kind of contact beyond the physical. I can’t explain it.”

“Of course, it meant we couldn’t keep on living as we were”, said Grandfather. “I suppose it was lucky we had no children. It made it easier for us when Meryet-Ra offered to give us a place here.”

“She’s set us up very nicely”, said Grandmother. “We’ve got a lovely room with a view of the grounds, and voice-activated TV, music, audio books and internet. Also, there’s a lovely young girl who comes in a few times a day to tend to us, see that our works are, well, ‘working’, seeing if we need anything, and so on.”

“If nothing else, it’s a very restful life”, said Grandfather.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111.title: The speaking clocks

11512112222131121111113111111111111111.content:
The reception broke up around midnight. Afterwards, Marcia went back to her room and changed into more casual clothing, before joining Alex on the balcony of his room. Alex had also changed and the two sat and talked and cuddled, and eventually did more than cuddle. In time, Marcia said “Yes” to Alex’s unspoken question and, after a quick side trip to the medicine cabinet, allowed him to lead her to his bed, where nature took its course.

Later, as she lay in Alex’s arms, listening to his gentle snoring, Marcia reflected that while it hadn’t been how Mark had imagined his “first time”, it had been quite good indeed. In the morning, Marcia and Alex showered together and, donning silk robes, ordered breakfast in bed sent up.

Just as they were finishing their breakfast, there was a knock at the door.

“Who is it?”, said Alex.

“It’s me, darlings”, said Camilla. “May I come in?”

Marcia shrugged at Alex, giving him a resigned look. Obviously, Camilla had guessed what they were up to.

“Yeah, sure”, said Alex.

Camilla came in, dressed in Alpine wear. She smiled at the sight of Alex and Marcia in bed together.

“I do hope you children have been playing safely”, she said.

“Yes, Mom, we have”, said Marcia, provoking a gale of laughter from Camilla.

“Several of us are going on a little hike up into the mountains. Since you’re obviously so well-rested, perhaps you’d like to join us?”

Marcia looked at Alex, who nodded assent.

“Sure”, she said, “Just give us a few minutes to get ready.”

“Of course, dear”, said Camilla. Meet us downstairs in half an hour.”

After she left, Marcia returned to her room to change. The dress she had worn the night before had been put away by the ubiquitous servants. She put on some hiking clothes, collected Alex from his room, and took the elevator downstairs.

In addition to Alex and Marcia, the hikers included Camilla and her sisters Hinoka, Elise and Sakura, Link and Zelda, Barbara, Elizabeth, Bayonetta and Captain Falcon.

Elizabeth caught Marcia’s eye, smirked and gave her a thumbs up. Marcia rolled her eyes. Did everyone know what they’d been up to?

Marcia noticed that Link looked quite pleased with himself, and that Zelda had a big, happy smile on her face.

“I think I can guess what you two’ve been up to”, said Marcia to Zelda.

“The same thing as you and Alex, I imagine”, replied Zelda.

The twelve friends set out, accompanied by four servants who were carrying a picnic lunch.
11512112222131121111113111111111111111.title: Exercise by Night and Exercise by Day

115121122221311211111131111111111111111.content:
Elsewhere, Meryet-Ra was meeting with Prunuspersica, Bill and Phoebe.

They were in one of the Pharaoh’s private chambers, where even her servants did not typically come.

“We’ve done a good deal of exploration, both in time and space”, said Bill. “And we’ve been doing some planning, as well.”

“Yesss”, said Phoebe. “We have decided to make a home for the family we are building togetherrr.”

“Where will you live?”, asked Meryet-Ra. “You know you’re always welcome here.”

“Thanks” said Bill. “But we’ve chosen a world of our own to shape in our own way.”

Also, she thought, we’ve seen the ways that you’ll re-shape this world - ways that you maybe haven’t fully worked out yourself yet – and we have chosen not to interfere. We’ve done some re-shaping of our own, after all. The worlds we’ve directed Queen Ghidorah to - none of them have intelligent life now, but some of them would have, in time. Some of them would in time have given rise to powerful malign intelligences, but Phoebe and I have chosen to use Queen Ghidorah to prevent them from ever developing.

Meryet-Ra in her turn pondered what Bill and Phoebe’s plans would be. She had to believe that they had visited Earth’s future, but she knew better than to ask them to tell her what was to come.

She turned to Prunuspersica.

“What plans does the Collective have?”, she asked.

“We, too, intend to seek a world of our own”, said Prunuspersica. “However. Before we go, we intend to do some recruiting. “

“’Recruiting’?”, asked Bill.

“Yes”, said Prunuspersica. “Our plan is to build a vessel capable of interstellar travel and seek out a world that the Mushroom Borg can call its own. To do so, the Collective must grow.”

“How do you plan to do this recruiting?”, asked Bill.

“As mundane as it may sound”, said Prunuspersica, “by advertising.”

“’Advertising’?”, said Meryet-Ra.

“Yes”, said Prunuspersica. “We will present the truth of what becoming part of the Collective means. We will accept only volunteers, and only adults capable of making an informed choice. We will screen the applicants carefully and accept only those with the sort of abilities and attitudes that we find desirable. Meryet-Ra, we would welcome your oversight and input regarding this process.”

“Certainly”, said Meryet-Ra, “I’d be glad to help.”

“We might be able to help as well”, said Bill. “We can pinpoint a world for you that would be perfect for your purposes.”

Sure, thought Meryet-Ra. You’ve already seen what world they’ll settle on in the future, haven’t you?

“Meryet-Ra”, said Prunuspersica, “there’s another favor I’d like to ask. When we begin to build our star vessel, may we build it here, where it will not be in the public view? We won’t any damage to the grounds.”

“Certainly”, said Meryet-Ra.

You’re certainly being careful to do everything where I can watch you, aren’t you?, she thought.

The four of them talked together some more before Bill, Phoebe and Prunuspersica left Meryet-Ra alone.

Over the last three months, Meryet-Ra had built up her palace and had extended her influence. It hadn’t been deliberate, but in order to operate without interference, she had found it expedient to take control of more and more government officials, until now, without having set out to do so, she now effectively controlled the Federal government, as well as the Colorado state government, as well as several state and county governments. She really hadn’t meant to, but it seemed that the more people she took control of, the easier it was. It was far more preferable than dealing with officials who were all too often corrupt, venal and foolish.

Additionally, she’d caught several spies by various corporations and by various countries’ intelligence agencies. They had found themselves adding to the diversity of her estate’s Pokémon population, as did the people who’d sent them. She took control of their successors, thus finding herself with a growing number of thralls around the world. It wasn’t like she was planning to take over the planet or anything like that. It was just that she knew that things in general would go more smoothly with certain elements under her control.
115121122221311211111131111111111111111.title: Plans

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Elsewhere, Marcia and her friends enjoyed their hike in the mountains and ate their picnic lunch while enjoying a spectacular view. They talked with each other and with some harpies who lived thereabouts.

“You know”, said Marcia, “I wasn’t sure I could manage a hike like that, but right now I feel as though I could climb mountains all day.”

“This is a magical place”, said Zelda, “it’s magic on a level that I can’t do, but I can recognize it. Just being here is naturally invigorating.”

“Meryet-Ra says that time works differently here”, said Marcia. “I wonder what that means exactly.”

“Whatever she wants it to mean, I suspect”, said Zelda. “I’m not entirely sure just how powerful she actually is. I’m like an amateur compared to her. “

“What about Bayonetta?”, asked Marcia.

“I don’t know her limits, either”, said Zelda. “She’s quite strong – maybe stronger than me. But I suspect that even she and I together wouldn’t be a match for Meryet-Ra.”

“Did I hear my name mentioned?”, asked Bayonetta, coming over to sit with them.

“Yeah”, said Zelda, “We were just discussing relative power levels. What do you think? Could the pair of us together take down Meryet-Ra?”

“Ah-ha-ha-ha-ha, no! Not a chance”, said Bayonetta. “She’d swat us like flies! If I was afraid of anything anymore, I’d be afraid of her.”

“What do you think her plans are?”, asked Marcia.

“I think she plans to help as many people as she can, and make the world a better place”, said Bayonetta. “Of course, as powerful as she is, she’s not all-powerful. Even she may someday be brought up against the fact that what we plan to do and what we end up doing are often quite different. I wonder how she would react?”

“I hope we’re not here if she ever finds out”, said Zelda.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Conversation

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Just then, a winged monkey landed next to Camilla and handed her a note.

“It’s from the Pharaoh, darlings”, she said. “Queen Ghidorah will be leaving soon, and she suggests that we may wish to come see them off.”

Wordlessly, they all agreed to go. Packing up the remnants of their lunch and headed back down towards the palace. The others were standing outside the palace. Marcia noticed that the Doctor’s TARDIS was parked nearby. Queen Ghidorah was standing in in a flat, open space about a mile away, which was a close as she could get without fear of accidentally stepping on someone.

“Goodbye, our friends”, she said. “We go to seek the stars.” So saying, she took to the air and flew off into the distance.”

“We’re taking off, too”, said Bill, indicating herself and Phoebe. “Spacetime won’t explore itself, after all.”

After making their goodbyes, Bill and Phoebe got into the TARDIS, which vanished, wheezing and groaning.

While the other dispersed or broke up into little groups to speak to one another, Marcia found herself on her own. Even Alex was off talking to Captain Falcon about something or other. She walked through Meryet-Ra’s garden, eventually coming to a cornfield.

As she looked at the rows of corn, Marcia heard a rustling sound behind her. She turned and saw Meryet-Ra herself coming up behind her.

“Hello, Marcia”, the Pharaoh said. “I was hoping we’d have a moment to talk.”

Meryet-Ra led Marcia to a bench that Marcia was reasonably certain hadn’t bene there a moment before.

“So, have you been enjoying your stay here?”, asked Meryet-Ra.

“Yes, very much”, said Marcia. “This place is so beautiful. I’m really grateful to you for the chance to stay here.”

“Think nothing of it”, said Meryet-Ra. “I feel a special kinship with you all. We’re linked in a way that I don’t think other people can understand. If I can offer you all a sanctuary if and when you need one, it’s the least I can do.”

“Well, we really appreciate it”. said Marcia.

“You’re quite welcome”, said the Pharaoh. “And while I’m thinking of it, let me give you this.”

Meryet-Ra removed a necklace from her pocket and place it around Marcia’s neck. The chain appeared to be made of gold. It had a green stone attached to it, in a setting crafted to look like an ankh.

“It’s beautiful”, said Marcia. “Are you sure…?”

“Of course”, said Meryet-Ra. “It’s magically attuned to you. It can’t be lost or stolen, and nr can it be given away or worn by anyone else but you. It’s not just pretty, though. Anytime you want to come here, just hold the ankh and wish, and you’ll be teleported to your room here. Don’t wait to be invited, come anytime you like, and stay as long as you like. And if you ever have any problems, let me know and if it’s something I can help with, I will.”

Marica hugged the Pharaoh and kissed her on the cheek. “Thank you so much”, she said. “You’ve always been good to us – as a teacher before and as you are now.”

“I’ve always tried my best”, said Meryet-Ra. “And now, if you’ll excuse me, I’ve got some business to attend to.”
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Goodbyes and Gifts

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Marcia wandered alone along the edge of the cornfield until she noticed someone coming towards her. It was Elise Ortiz, who had been Petey.

Spotting Marica, Elise gave her a cheerful greeting and a hug.

“So, how ya been?”, asked Elise.

“Good”, said Marcia. “I think you’d have to work at it to feel bad here.”

“Yeah”, said Elise. “Say, the last three months sure have been weird, haven’t they?”

“That’s for sure”, said Marcia. “Still, I feel like they weren’t as bad as they might have been. I mean, it’s been a big adjustment, but I wonder that we haven’t all gone crazy, especially people like Dedede or Queen Ghidorah. Jamie’s magic shielding us, maybe.”

“Maybe”, said Elise. Suddenly, she laughed.

“What’s funny?”, asked Marcia.

“It’s just – talking about big adjustments”, said Elise. “I wanted to see a cute girl naked, but I never thought she would be me!”

“How do you think I feel?”, laughed Marcia. “I became my own girlfriend!”

They’d been walking as they talked and had come to a vegetable garden being tended by several young women who seemed to be part goat. Marcia tried to think of the proper word. Satyrs? Nymphs?

One of the gardeners spotted them and sketched a brief bow, saying “My Ladies”.

Marcia and Elise bowed back. Marcia thought about trying to start a conversation with the goat-girl, but she seemed busy, so she left her alone.

“Huh”, said Elise, when they were some way away. “To think they’re all volunteers. I don’t think I’d volunteer to be half-goat.”

“I have the impression that a lot of these girls are from bad backgrounds. Being goat-girls in a magical garden probably seems like a sweet deal to them.”

“Maybe so”, said Elise.

Past the garden, they came to a forest. In the distance, a Trevenant was leading several Phantumps. It eyed the two girls warily and then, having apparently decided they were acceptable, waved an arm/branch at them before shepherding its charges further into the woods.

I wonder if that’s Joey Dubois, thought Marcia. I guess we’ll never know.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Walking With Elise

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Marcia and Elise continued to chat as they walked along a path through the forest. From time to time they saw various creatures – some normal forest animals and some Pokémon. Finally, they came to a pool of water. The water was smooth and crystal-clear.

“I’m all sweaty”, said Elise. “I could go for a swim. How about you?”

“Why not?”, said Marcia. “I suppose our stuff will be alright here.”

“Yeah”, said Elise, who began stripping off her clothes.

“Hey, it’s just us girls”, she said, when she saw Marcia looking at her.

“OK”, said Marcia, stripping off her clothes. She noticed that Elise had a necklace like hers.

“Hey, you got one of those, too?”, she said.

“Yeah, Meryet-Ra gave it to me earlier.” Soon, the necklaces were all they were wearing. They dove int the pool together. The water was comfortably warm, and it didn’t hurt their eyes when they opened them underwater. There were plants growing in the pool, and a few small fish swimming around. Elise pointed to one side of the pond where there was a large, round hole, apparently the entrance to an underwater tunnel. Then, she pointed up. Marcia took the hint, and the two girls surfaced.

“So, shall we investigate?”, asked Elise.

“OK, but let’s be careful”, said Marcia. Elise nodded, they took deep breaths and dove under again. They swam into the tunnel, which proved to be big enough for both of them to swim side by side. It was pitch dark inside once they got a little way inside, so they had to grope their way along. The tunnel seemed long to Marcia, but to her surprise, she had no trouble holding her breath.

After a while, they realized that the tunnel was curving upward, and they saw a faint green light ahead. Moving towards it, they emerged out of the water into a room that was lit by a large, glowing green crystal embedded in the ceiling. The air was pleasantly warm, so that they didn’t feel a chill even though they were soaking wet.

The room was roughly circular, maybe thirty feet in diameter. The tunnel mouth was on one side, and there appeared to be no other exits. There were small vents near the top that allowed for air circulation. In the middle of the room was what appeared to be an extra-large bean bag chair, one easily big enough for half a dozen people to lie on.

“What’s this doing here?”, said Elise. “Do you suppose someone lives here?”

“Maybe”, said Marcia. “It doesn’t look ‘lived in’, though. Maybe Meryet-Ra left it here for anyone like us who found this place.”

“Maybe”, said Elise, “I think I’ll give it a try.” She plopped herself down and sank int the chair. She smiled and said, “Oh, yeah, this is comfy, alright.”

Marcia lay down next to her. It was comfortable, alright, and the green light was soooo soothing. She yawned and closed her eyes. Soon the room was silent except for the gentle snores of the two sleeping girls.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: A Mysterious Room

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
She left the underground lair where she had slept and emerged into the waters of the bay. She surfaced and stood still for a moment, savoring the sensation of the cool water running down her scales.

She looked at the human city that spread around the edges of the bay and extended far inland. As always, the sight enraged her. She could not articulate why it enraged her, it just did. It was wrong, it was an offence. It had to be destroyed, so she would destroy it.

She let out a loud roar and began to walk to shore. Several boats labored to get out of her way. Those that failed to do so, she sank. The humans on shore had noticed her, and by the time she reached the shoreline, hastily-gathered units of soldiers began firing small arms at her. She barely noticed their bullets, but nevertheless, Cherenkov light danced along her dorsal spines and she spat a stream of blue fire at them, incinerating them. She was indifferent to the cries of the few survivors as she marched onto land.

The humans fled from her as she entered the city. She didn’t particularly care if they lived or died. Those that moved quickly enough lived, those that were too slow she trampled or burned, occasionally adding a little variety by swiping at them with her massive tail.

As she walked, she smashed and burned buildings and vehicles. When she crossed a train line, she picked up a train car, watching with mild curiosity as humans spilled out of it, and then tossing it aside. Planes came and fired missiles at her. She swatted at those that came too close to her and burned one with her heat beam. The rest flew away. It didn’t matter, the missiles were nothing more than pinpricks to her.

More soldiers came, this time with tanks and artillery. They fared no better than their comrades. She proceeded through the city, spreading death and devastation, until all was a sea of flames. Finally, her rage was sated. She returned to the sea, smashing a few more boats almost absented-mindedly.

Diving under the waves, she returned to her lair and went to sleep.

Marcia woke up. For one bizarre, disorienting moment she was uncertain whether she was Marcia who had dreamed of being Godzilla or Godzilla who was dreaming of being Marcia.

She sat up. It felt weird to be human again. She looked at Elise, who opened her eyes and looked at Marcia.

“Wow”, said Elise. “I just had the weirdest dream.”

“Yeah, me too”, said Marcia. She saw a haunted look in Elise’s eyes that she suspected was mirrored in her own. Neither of them asked what the other had dreamed about, and neither of them volunteered to tell her own dream.

There was an awkward silence that lasted a few minutes, until Marcia finally noticed that she was ravenous.

“Damn, I could eat a horse”, she said.

“Yeah, me too”, said Elise. “I wonder how long we were asleep for. I hope it wasn’t a Rip Van Winkle thing where we were asleep for a hundred years.”

“Nah, Meryet-Ra wouldn’t allow that”, said Marcia.

“I guess not”, said Elise. “However long it’s been, let’s go score some chow,”

The two girls dove into the water and swam through the tunnel and back out into the pool. Their clothes were where they had left them. Next to their clothes was a bag with two large towels and two small towels.

“Nice to have servants, isn’t it?”, said Elise.

“Yeah, I could get used to it”, said Marcia.

They dried themselves off with the large towels and wrapped the smaller towels around their hair. Marcia looked at her phone. It was nearly five. They had been asleep for a while!

They got dressed and headed back to the palace. When they reached the palace grounds, a maid appeared and took the bag with the large towels from them.

Camilla was sitting on a lounge chair reading and looked up when she saw them.

“Oh, there you are, darlings”, she said. “We were starting to think you two had run off together.”

“Oh, no”, said Elise, winking, “We just went for a swim and then slept together. I think I’m gonna go up and grab a shower.”

“Yeah, me too”, said Marcia.

Marcia went up to her room. She ran into Alex outside her door.

“Hey, babe, where ya been?”, he asked.

“I went swimming with Elise”, she replied. “I was just gonna grab a shower. Care to join me?”

“I think that would be fun”, he replied.

When they were in the shower together, they were playful at first, but after a moment Marcia found herself clinging desperately to Alex.

“What’s wrong, babe?”, he asked.

She told him about the room she and Elise had found, and about her dream.

“You were Godzilla?”, he said.

“I know it sounds crazy, or like something an eight year-old boy would have loved, but it was awful! I was filled with rage and killing people, stepping on them like they were ants. “

Alex held her tight, and after they left the shower, they found their way to her bed and just held each other for a long time. Eventually, nature took its course, but when it did, Alex went out of his way to be especially gentle.

Afterward, she remembered that she was really, really hungry.

“Sweetie, I’m about to faint from hunger”, she said. “Would you mind satisfying another of my appetites?”

Alex smiled and went over to the kitchenette. “What would you like, kid?”

“Surprise me”, she replied.

A few minutes later, he returned to the bed with ham sandwiches, potato chips and Cokes for them both. Marcia practically inhaled hers.

“Ah, that hit the spot”, she said. “Now I’ve got enough strength back to go find some dinner.”

Alex laughed. The two of them got dressed and went downstairs.
