Dinner that night was a much less formal affair. They gathered together in a small, intimate dining room, and they were all dressed in casual clothes, even Meryet-Ra. For the first time since their transformation, she looked like Maria Ferzoco the teacher and not the “Pharaoh of the Solar System”.

Not everyone was there: It was Marcia, Alex, Elizabeth, Meryet-Ra, Barbara, Link, Zelda, Camilla, Hinoka, Elise, Sakura, Isabelle, Bayonetta and Captain Falcon. No one asked where the others were, presumably they were attending to business of their own.

Dinner was buffet-style, self-serve with only a minimal number of servants. It was low-key but pleasant. At one point in the evening, Marcia took Elise aside and said, “How ya holdin’ up, kid?”

“I’m OK”, said Elise. “I told Camilla about the room, and my dream.”

“Yeah”, said Marcia. “I told Alex.”

“Y’know”, said Elise. “the funny thing is, I’m gonna go back there, someday. Not right away, but someday.”

“Yeah, me too”, said Marcia, and it was only as she said it that she realized that she meant it.

At the end of the night, Alex came over and kissed Marcia goodnight. Somehow, he’d sensed that she didn’t want to sleep with him that night, and secure and mature enough not to take it as a rejection. Sometimes it was good to have a boyfriend who used to be a girl.

She sat alone on her room’s balcony for a long time, before she went into her room, and called Liz’s room on her room phone.

“Hello?”, said Liz, sleepily.

“Hi, Liz”, said Marcia. “Remember when we were little kids, and you’d have a nightmare or there was a loud thunderstorm, and you’d come and slip into my bed? Sometimes I wouldn’t notice until the morning.”

“Yeah, so?”, said Liz. “Oh! Did you want to come over?”

“Yeah”, said Marcia. “C-can I? Please?”

“OK, sure.”

“Thanks, Liz, I’ll be right over.”

Liz greeted Marcia at her room door, giving her a big hug.

“Want to talk about it?”, asked Liz.

“Later”, said Marcia. “For now, I just want to sleep.”

Soon Marcia was fast asleep, secure in her little sister’s arms, which were identical to her own.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: A Dream of Death and Destruction

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
The next morning, Marcia told Elizabeth about the room and the dream she’d had.

“Wow, that was wild”, said Elizabeth. “I can see why it upset you.”

“I feel better today”, said Marcia. “Thank you for letting me crash with you.”

“No probs”, said Liz. “Say, are you hungry? Shall I order up some breakfast?”

“Sure”, said Marcia. “I could eat.”

When the breakfast arrived, they took it out onto Liz’s balcony. While they were eating, Marcia noticed that Liz was wearing a necklace like her own. Apparently, Meryet-Ra had given her one, too.

After breakfast, Marcia returned to her room, showered and got dressed. Then she went to Alex’s room, where he was sitting on his couch, listening to music.

“Hey, babe”, he said. “What’s up?”

‘Oh, I was just thinking it was probably time for us to head home”, she said, “what with the weekend nearly being over.”

“Yeah, I suppose so’, he said. “Too bad. I could get used to this lifestyle.”

“Yeah, me too”, said Marcia. “Maybe Meryet-Ra will give us jobs after we get out of school.”

“Maybe you, babe”, said Alex. “She doesn’t seem to hire guys.”

“Fine”, said Marcia, “I’ll get a job and you can be my kept man.”

They both laughed at that.

Then, Alex said: “When do you want to head home?”

“After lunch, I guess”, she replied. “We should talk to Liz.”

They went and talked to Liz, and they all agreed to go home after lunch.
They passed the rest of the morning hanging out with their friends. Lunch was quiet. Afterwards, they leave of Meryet-Ra and their friends. When they returned to their rooms, they found their bags already packed.

After saying goodbye to everyone, they used their necklaces to return home, as Meryet-Ra had in structed them. After a brief flash of cool light, Marcia found herself back in her room at home.

She went out into the hall and saw her mother.

“Marcia? What are you doing here? I just saw you leave.”, she asked.

“Huh?”, said Marcia. “But I’ve been gone for -“

She took out her phone and looked at the date and time. It was a minute after she’d left.

“Oh, I get it”, she said. “Meryet-Ra said time worked differently there.”

She explained to her mother that she’d been at Meryet-Ra’s for quite some time.

“What a lovely necklace you have there”, her mother said.

“Yeah, it’s nice, isn’t it? Meryet-Ra gave one to each of us.”

“Hey, guys”, said Elizabeth from behind them.

“Oh, hello, dear, you’re back, too?”, said their mother.

Behind their mother’s back, Marcia pointed to her necklace with her right hand and covered her mouth with her left.

Aloud, Marcia said, “Hey, I was just telling Mom about how Meryet-Ra sent us back right after we left.”

“Yeah, it’s cool”, said Elizabeth. “I got all my homework done while I was there.”

Liz made an “OK” sign behind their mother’s back.

“Why don’t you come and tell me all about it?”, said Mom.

“Sure”, said Marcia. “I just gotta go real quick”

Once she was in the bathroom, she quickly texted Alex: “PLZ TELL ME U DINT TELL UR RENTS ABT WHAT NECKLACES CN DO.”

She was gratified when he answered immediately: “NO WORRIES. WY AHED OF U. LUV U.”

She another text to Camilla and Hinoka (Elise and Sakura didn’t have cellphones yet). She didn’t get an answer, but she wasn’t sure when they’d left. Hopefully, they’d pick up on what she’d picked up on:

If the necklaces returned them home right after they left, then they could go use it to go to Meryet-Ra’s palace whenever they liked, and spend as much time there as they wanted, with their parents none the wiser. She supposed that there was a possibility that Meryet-Ra might tell their parents, but somehow Marcia didn’t think she would. She was reasonably certain that the Pharaoh had known exactly what she and Alex had been up to – certainly everyone else seemed to have figured it out – but she’d said nothing about it. Also, she’d told them to come and go as they pleased.

It would be a perfect hang-out, and a place where she and Alex could “dance in the sheets” whenever they liked. Ah, the possibilities. Fortunately, Liz and Alex seemed to have picked up on it. She’d have a little chat with Liz later to make sure. Finishing up in the bathroom, she went downstairs to join her mother and sister.

Marcia continued with her new “normal” life, alternating time in the “mundane” world with time in Meryet-Ra’s realm. She and Alex had regular “dates” there, and, as she’d expected, Meryet-Ra showed no interest in them. Interestingly, her grades improved, as she now had as much time as she wanted to do homework.

In the mundane realm, Princess Prunuspersica launched a worldwide recruitment campaign for membership in the Mushroom Borg Collective. Marcia saw ads in print, on-line, ad on TV and radio. The campaign was carefully slanted to convey the notion that membership was a rare privilege that would only be granted to those who met the Collective’s rigorous standards. (This had the added advantage of being true.)

Marcia met Prunuspersica during one of her visits to the Pharaoh’s realm, where the Princess was overseeing the construction of her cube ship. Hundreds of drones were busily working on the shell of the vessel, which was bigger than Marcia had expected.

“Hey, Princess”, said Marcia. “How’s the recruitment campaign going?”

“Pretty well, actually”, said the Princess. “We’ve had over a hundred thousand applicants worldwide, and more of them met our standards than I had expected. We’ve accepted two thousand people for assimilation. We’re going to announce this afternoon that recruitment is being closed – for now, at least. We may open it up again once we’ve settled our new world, if it seems necessary, and Meryet-Ra has no objection. Actually, we have a recruit coming in this morning. Would you like to witness her assimilation?”

“Sure, if that’s OK”, said Marcia.

Prunuspersica led her over to a platform near the cube ship. A drone materialized on the platform, accompanied by an athletic young woman dressed in casual clothing. She looked vaguely familiar to Marcia.

“Hello, Charlotte, I’m Princess Prunuspersica. Are you ready for assimilation?”

“Yes, ma’am”, said Charlotte. “What do you need me to do?”

“Just hold still”, said Prunuspersica, holding her arm out towards Charlotte’s neck. Thin tubules extended from Prunuspersica’s and touched Charlotte’s skin. Charlotte’s skin turned white and her clothing turned into pink cybernetic armor. A surprised look briefly passed over Charlotte’s face, and then the new-made drone marched over to the cube ship and began helping in its construction.

“That’s it?”, said Marcia.

“That’s all there is to it”, said Prunuspersica.

“Not much like the assimilations were on TV”, said Marcia.

“Our Collective has elements of magic as well as science”, the Princess replied, “so the process is somewhat smoother for us.”

“She looked familiar”, said Marcia.

“She was Charlotte van Dijn”, said Prunuspersica. “Olympic boxer, genius mathematician, high-level chess player and a pretty good saxophonist. A real Renaissance woman. We are privileged that she chose to become part of us.”
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Back to "Normal"?

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
A few weeks later, Marcia and Alex made an “official” visit to Meryet-Ra’s realm – that is, one that their parents knew about. Bayonetta, Bowser, Captain Falcon and Ophelia Voorhees were taking off to explore the galaxy together.

“Meryet-Ra got Prunuspersica to have the Collective build a starship for us”, explained Bayonetta. “In return, we’ve agreed to send back reports on what we find out there.”

“How long do you think you’ll be gone?”, asked Marcia.

“Hard to say”, said Bayonetta. “Maybe not so far at first. We’ll definitely come back for visits now and then.”
There was a farewell luncheon, and then the intrepid explorers took off for parts unknown.

A short while after that, Prunuspersica and her Collective left Earth as well, heading for their new homeworld.

While Marcia and her friends busied themselves with their various concerns, Meryet-Ra was not idle. She was aware of what her former students were up to. Had she still been a high school teacher, or even just an ordinary mortal of any sort, her attitude might have been different, but now he saw things on a different level, and thought longer term than she had in the past. She couldn’t see the future the way Bill could, of course, but she could see potential futures, and began working to determine which of those futures was the most favorable, and working out how to make the chosen future a reality.

She had extended her control over the U.S. government and several state governments, as well as developing footholds in several foreign governments. It had never been her plan to take over the world, but of the futures she had seen, the most hopeful one she had seen showed humanity united under her guidance, so she felt she had no choice. That this might be a rationalization of her part was a thought that had occurred to her, but after much soul-searching, she was convinced that her motives were pure.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Departures and Plans

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Time passed, and Marcia, Alex, Hinoka, Camilla, Zelda and Link all graduated from high school and turned eighteen at around the same time. Meryet-Ra hosted a grand celebration at her palace with their families and friends in attendance.

As she observed the happy revelers, the Pharaoh considered her own progress. She now controlled every elected official at every level in the United States of America. Oh, she still allowed elections, even though it didn’t matter who won. She’d placed spells on the offices themselves, so that whoever held them became hers, even though they didn’t know it themselves. She knew that it was important to maintain the familiar forms while she was cementing her control.

Additionally, she had taken control of all the military leaders, police departments, and intelligence agencies. Leading industrialists and media figures. The general public knew nothing of this. If anything, they may have noticed that the government was running more smoothly. Certainly, prison overcrowding was becoming less of a problem. Numerous prisoners who should never have been locked up in the first place were freed, and numerous prisoners who were deemed incorrigible found themselves living out their lives as winged monkeys and Pokémon on the grounds of Meryet-Ra’s estate. Almost every kind of Pokémon were represented there, except for certain of the Mythicals and Legendaries. Meryet-Ra saw no benefit in creating things like Arceus, Eternatus or Yveltal.

Meryet-Ra truly didn’t like overriding people’s wills like that, but she knew that the only way to get humans to cooperate for the common good was to compel them, at least for now. Maybe someday they would learn to get along freely. Until then, humanity would have her gentle hand to guide them.

There was still a lot of work to do – while she now had footholds in every government on Earth, it would be some time before she controlled the whole world the way she controlled the U.S.A. For now, she allowed herself to enjoy the evening.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Time Passes

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Alex and Marcia went to separate colleges, Alex to study business administration and Marcia to study literature. Now that they were of age, they lived openly together in their rooms in Meryet-Ra’s palace, commuting to their schools using their amulets. Link and Zelda were doing likewise, and the foursome spent a lot of time together. They were frequently joined by Camilla and Hinoka, who were still living at home, but who visited the palace frequently. While the two sisters had begun dating, they had not yet found that special someone.

Hinoka (who had once been Benny Ortiz) discussed it with Marcia one afternoon.

“You know what it was like, Marcia”, she said. “It was strange enough becoming a girl, but realizing that I was now attracted to guys was like an extra level of weirdness, especially when I found myself getting the hots for a guy I’d been buddies with.”

“How do you think I felt?”, said Marcia, ‘”Having what had been my girlfriend’s body while she had mine was off the hook, and it got really weird when my little sister turned into a copy of me. Imagine if all four of you had turned into Camillas!”

“Wow, that’s a disturbing thought”, said Hinoka.

“Still”, smirked Marcia, “when we started the naughty stuff, it was helpful that I knew exactly where the sensitive spots on Alex’s body were.”

“OK, TMI”, said Hinoka, laughing.

“Well, it’s been interesting for the scientists, anyway”, said Marcia. “They say Liz and I are genetically identical. Even identical twins have some differences, so there’s lots of things they can test with us that they can’t test with anyone else. They say that if either of us ever needs a transplant, the other would be a perfect donor.”

“Huh”, said Hinoka. “I wonder if her body would respond to nerve impulses from yours, or vice versa.”

“Dunno”, said Marcia. “I don’t think that’s occurred to them. I don’t know that I want to be that close to her. Oh, well. We don’t really look exactly alike, anymore. It’s not just that we both go out of our way to dress and wear our hair differently, but she’s always been more of a jockette than I have. She’s a star on the track team, and her muscles have developed differently, too.”

“Say, on a different note”, said Hinoka, “Have you ever gone back to that ‘dream room’ that Elise told me about?”

“No”, said Marcia. “I’ve thought about it, but I’ve never worked up the nerve to go back there. Why, did you want to go?”

“Yeah”, said Hinoka, “I’m a little scared, but I would.”

“It’s late tonight”, said Marcia. “Shall we go in the morning?”

“Alright”, said Hinoka. “Let’s do it.”

They met the next morning. Each of them was carrying a bag with a swimsuit and a towel in it. They chatted casually as Marcia led Hinoka to the pond. When they got to the pond, they changed into their swimsuits. Marcia couldn’t help but take note of what a hot body Hinoka had. Hinoka usually was very tomboyish – that was her character, complemented by the remnants of Benny’s personality that still lived within her.

Well, it’s her choice, thought Marcia. But it’s kind of a shame. She could look really good if she ever wanted to dress like a girl.

They dove into the pool and made their way through the tunnel to the room. The chamber was just as Marcia remembered it. Wordlessly, they settled onto the bean bag couch. As they fell asleep, Marcia felt Hinoka reach out to hold her hand.

Kay and Emmy lived in a simple but sturdy cabin outside a town about fifty miles east of the Loovill Dead Zone. They were twin four year-old girls and while theirs was a harsh environment in which children had to grow up fast, at their age, they weren’t expected to work yet.

Their father eked out a hardscrabble living as a farmer, supplementing the family’s diet with whatever animals he could successfully hunt. Their mother worked the farm as well and had a sideline as a seamstress.

The girls themselves never went outside the cabin alone- there weren’t so many bandits around these days, and no one had seen any wild folks near the town in over three generations, but still, there were plenty of wild animals around, bears and wolves and such, that would see two unattended little girls as tasty snacks.

They’d been born in the cabin and had never been as much as a mile from it. For that matter, their mother seldom went far from home, either. It was nearly always her father who went into town, when it was necessary.

It was a lonely life – they had not yet met anyone else their own age. Still, at least they had each other. And although they knew only a little about it, life was better these days. The Dead Zone shrank year by year, albeit slowly. When the town had been founded, many generations ago, shortly after the Burning War, the edge of the Dead Zone had been only twenty miles away. And if there were more predator animals in the woods these days, there were more food animals, too.

Mostly the girls played with their few toys, and watched as their mother did her chores, carefully explaining to the girls the things they would be expected to do when they were only a few years older. At night, after dinner, their father would gather them all together for story time. Sometimes he would read – both parents could read, but their father was the best for reading out loud, possessing a deep, rich voice. The family owned a few books, rare items that had been in the family for generations. All were reprints of much older books from before the War – the Bible, Grimm’s Fairy Tales (which the girls loved), the Complete Works of Shakespeare (which the girls didn’t really understand), The Annotated Sherlock Holmes (which made Emmy want to be a detective), and something called The Mystery Science Theater 3000 Amazing Colossal Episode Guide (which none of them understood).

But what the girls liked best when their father would tell them stories, stories of the world before the Burning War, stories of heroes like Superman and Luke Sidewalker, and monsters like Godzilla and Frankensense. Some were old stories handed down over the years, others were ones he’d made up himself.

Tonight, they were sitting on the couch in front of the fireplace, nestled between their parents. Their father was telling them a story about Batman fighting the Riddler, and every time the Riddler told a riddle he would challenge them to solve it, and when one of them solved it (often with a gentle hint from their mother), he looked pleased and said that it was good they were learning to think.

As he finished up the story (Batman won, Batman always won), the girls drifted off to sleep, feeling as safe as they could in such a dangerous world.

Marcia woke up in the chamber, noticing that Hinoka was still holding her hand. On a hunch, she said, “Hey, Kay, wake up!”

Hinoka looked surprised for a second, then smiled and said, “OK, Emmy!”

“So, we did have the same dream!”, said Marcia. “I wonder why. Maybe because we were holding hands?”

“Sorry”, said Hinoka, “I was a little nervous. The way Elise described what happened was a little scary.”

“I understand”, said Marcia. “That one was weird in a different way. A strange, terrible place, but those two little girls were happy and loved.”

“I guess you can feel loved anywhere”, said Hinoka.

“Do you think that was just a dream, or was it a real place, a link to another world, another time?”, asked Marcia.

“I don’t know”, said Hinoka. “It sure felt real. Maybe every dream is real, somewhere.”

While they’d always been friendly, the shared dream led Marcia and Hinoka to become even closer friends, and they began to spend a lot more time together than they had in the past.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Another Dream

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
More time passed. Marcia and her friends graduated from college. Meryet-Ra gave Marcia and Alex jobs. To Alex she gave a position in the corporation which she had created for her business dealings with the outside world. To Marcia, she gave a position with the literary division of the same corporation, overseeing books about and by Meryet-Ra. Barbara was now serving as Meryet-Ra’s Librarian, so she and Marcia worked together a lot as well.

One Sunday afternoon shortly after they began working at their new jobs, Alex took her on a hike in the hills, ostensibly for a picnic, but she’d suspected that he’d had an ulterior motive, and he soon proved her right.

When they’d reached a beautiful spot that overlooked a valley, he’d gotten down on one knee, presented her with a diamond engagement ring, saying “Marcia, will you marry me?”

She’d been certain it was coming. They’d had several serious talks about the future, and he’d obviously been sounding her out. He should’ve known what her answer would be, and probably he was 99% certain, but there was enough in that 1% for him to have a tiny amount of doubt.

Still, she smiled at him, and gave the only answer she could: “Yes!”

When he eventually stopped kissing her, he broke out a bottle of champagne he’d brought with him and they’d celebrated – and “practiced” for their honeymoon.

Alter, they went and notified their friends and family. A few weeks later, Link and Zelda announced their engagement, as well. The two couples had toyed with the idea of a double wedding, but in the end had decided against it.

Alex and Marcia were married first, in a ceremony at their local church. Elizabeth was Marcia’s maid of honor, and Barbara, Hinoka, Camilla, and Elise were her bridesmaids. Before she left her home on the morning of her wedding, Marcia looked at herself in her wedding dress in her bedroom mirror.

“You look great, Sis”, said Elizabeth.

“Yes, really lovely, darling”, added Camilla.

“Gorgeous”, said Hinoka.

Marcia’s mother stuck her head into the room. “Are you ready to go, dear?”

“As ready as I’ll ever be”, said Marcia.

The ceremony went by in a blur until she found herself saying “I do” and kissing her new husband.

The reception was at a nearby restaurant. Among the guests was a woman in plain beige dress. It took her a minute to recognize her as Meryet-Ra.

“I didn’t recognize you without your ‘Pharaoh’ gear on”, said Marcia.

“Even I wouldn’t try to outshine a bride on her wedding day”, said Meryet-Ra.

“I can’t believe you gave us a home in your realm as a wedding present”, said Marcia.

“Oh, think nothing of it”, said Meryet-Ra, smiling. “When you’ve got power like mine, the least you can do is make life easier for your friends.”

Meryet-Ra watched as Marcia mingled with her other guests. It was good to relax, especially since she’d been so busy the last four years. She now had complete control over North America, from the Arctic to Panama. Her control of Western Europe and Japan was nearly complete, and she was making progress in other areas. All in all, she’d earned another brief rest.

After the reception, Alex and Marcia left for their honeymoon in Niagara Falls. By the next morning - although she wouldn’t know it for a while - Marcia was pregnant. By the time they attended Link and Zelda’s wedding, Marcia was already starting to “show”.

Link and Zelda had also been given jobs by Meryet-Ra, and a home in her realm near Alex and Marcia’s. Zelda, too, was soon pregnant.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: More Time Passes

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Marcia and Zelda’s pregnancies were smooth and trouble-free, almost supernaturally so. In due course of time, Marcia gave birth to a daughter that she and Alex named Sarah, after Marcia’s aunt. Shortly thereafter, Zelda gave birth to a son that she and Link named Henry, after her grandfather.

Marcia and Link spent a lot of time together. Being a young mother was relatively easy since they were living in Meryet-Ra’s realm. Both couples were well-paid, enough to afford servants of their own. And somehow, just being in her magical realm was invigorating all by itself.

Marcia and Zelda made the usual circuit of Showing Off the New Babies, first to “Aunts” Camilla, Hinoka and Barbara, all of whom now lived and worked in Meryet’s realm, and then to “Aunt” Bridget the mermaid, and to “Aunts” Elise and Sakura when they came to visit, and of course, to her literal Aunt Elizabeth.

Meryet-Ra had been one of the first to see the new babies, and even Bill and Phoebe had come to visit with their own daughter, Susan, the first of the Dalek/Time Lord Hybrids. Of course, the children also met Isabelle and King Dedede, both of whom were now aides to the Pharaoh. Prunuspersica had sent a congratulatory message by subspace radio, as had the four Wanderers Bowser, Ophelia, Bayonetta and Captain Falcon. Bill had even promised to let Queen Ghidorah know the good news when next they saw her.

Finally, Marcia and Zelda went to see Grandfather and Grandmother Clock. They were amiable but distant. After the ritual Admiration of the Babies, they made small talk which petered out somewhat awkwardly. As soon as they could do so politely, the two young mothers beat a hasty retreat.

They described their visit to Meryet-Ra.

“It’s not just you”, the Pharaoh said. “They’ve been increasingly remote with everyone over the years. They’ll speak when spoken to, but they never initiate conversation anymore, not even with their servants. They haven’t been out of their room in years and seem perfectly content not to have any interactions with others. In fact, we’re not even sure they talk to each other, anymore. I don’t really know what to make of it – but as far as we can tell, they don’t seem unhappy.”

In their room, the two clocks stood, apparently unspeaking, the only sound the ticking of their mechanisms as they marked off the hours and the low murmur of the television, set on a news channel, although they seldom paid much attention to it.

They knew that the humans were concerned about them and wondered why they so seldom spoke. The humans didn’t understand that it was through their ticking that they communicated with one another, on a much deeper level than speech. They’d transcended the flesh, in a way that they suspected even Meryet-Ra couldn’t understand. It had been a difficult transition at first, but in a surprisingly short time, they had found they themselves developing a serene acceptance of their situation. True, they’d lost physical intimacy, but in time they’d found themselves developing a kind of “spiritual intimacy” beyond what they’d known as humans. As time had passed and they lived their lives marking off the hours, they’d begun to lose interest in human affairs. It wasn’t that they bore any ill-will towards their friends, it was just that they had acquired a new perspective on time. It passed, humans would go about their mundane affairs, and everything they did would eventually become part of the past They were glad that their friends were happy, but they understood that happiness – like everything else, really – was transitory.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Showing Off the Babies

1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.content:
Marcia and Zelda proved to be remarkably fecund. Over the next seven years, they each gave birth to three more girls and four boys each, leaving them with four daughters and four sons apiece.
Alex and Marcia’s children were Sarah, Alexandra, Mark, Patricia, John, Luke, Matthew and Patricia.

Link and Zelda’s children were Henry, Robert, Philip, Andrea, Jane, Daniel, Jennifer and Anita.

During these years, Camilla, Hinoka, Barbara, Elise, Sakura and Elizabeth all got married. All of them except Elizabeth at least two children, except Elizabeth, who was six months pregnant with her first child around the time that Marcia’s eighth child was born. All of them had smooth, trouble-free pregnancies and found themselves losing their “baby weight” easily. Their parents remarked how none of them seemed to look a day over twenty-one.

Meryet-Ra had not been idle, either. By the time she held young Anita Swenson in her arms, the Pharaoh had complete control over all the world’s governments and militaries, as well as all of the world’s corporations, including the journalism and entertainment industries. Religious leaders, too, were under her control. Effectively, she ruled the world, albeit from behind the scenes.

Meryet-Ra had been planning carefully for some time. She had taken care of her friends, giving them luxurious homes, fulfilling work and ensuring that they and their families enjoyed excellent health and long – perhaps eternal – life, subtly tying them to herself. She was reluctant to interfere directly with their minds, doing so only to the minimum extent necessary to keep them from questioning her actions. Those that were beyond her control – Bill, Phoebe, Prunuspersica, Queen Ghidorah – seemed content to tend to their own affairs.

As for her Earthbound friends, she wanted them onside not just for their own sakes, but because she would need their help once she had completed the next step in her plan, which was taking direct control of the world, and becoming the de jure Pharaoh of the Solar System, and not just the de facto.
1151211222213112111111311111111111111111.title: Families and Plans

115121122221311213.content:
"It's for...well, it's hard to describe. You see, for us, science and art are all part of the same things, so it's sort of like both a science fair and an art fair."

"You did all this to us for a school project? What was it supposed to be all about?", asked Phoebe.

"Well, the project is to study a timeline, and then re-write it in some way. Then I'll be graded for my technique and the artistic qualities of what I do", explained Jamie.

"And that involved holding a costume party and turning us into what we dressed up as?", asked Camilla.

"Yeah, that's my gimmick", said Jamie. "I decided to let you choose your costumes, and then use whatever you dressed up as inspiration for how I was going to to re-write your world's history. Doing it the way I did it was just my little prank on you - one last joke before I left you."

""'Left us'?", asked Marcia.

"Well, yeah", said Jamie. "I can't be in your timeline when I re-write it, you see. I have to go home now. Just a quick 'heads up' about what's going to happen: I've interfered with your minds a little - I suppressed your natural instincts a bit. I wanted to see your fear and confusion a bit, but I didn't want you going insane, or anything. You should never carry a gag that far. Anyway, I'll be leaving soon, and then I'll re-write your world. The memories of your re-written lives will start filtering into your heads gradually over the next day or so. You'll retain your memories of your old lives for about a day or two, so you'll be able to compare and contrast you new and old lives, but after that, they'll fade and you'll forget that anything has changed."

Jamie smiled at them, and sighed. "I'm gonna miss you guys", she said, "I had fun here. I asked my parents if I could keep you all as souvenirs, but they said I could only keep two of you, so I decided to keep Steve and Morgan. Come up here, you two."

Steve and Morgan obediently flew up and landed on Jamie's outstretched hand.

"You - you can't keep people as souvenirs!", said Marcia.

"Sure I can", said Jamie. "Don't worry, though, I'll take good care of them, heck, I'll probably make them immortal. They'll certainly have longer, happier lives with me than they would have had here. Actually, I think I'll breed them. I know a number of my friends back home, who'd love to have one of these as a pet.
And in a day or two, you won't even miss them. There will still be winged monkeys here, though, so they'll sort of live on here. Anyway, gotta go now. Oops, almost forgot! Marcia, I've got an additional 'surprise' for you! Enjoy! Bye, now!"

Jamie - and Steve and Morgan with her - vanished in a sphere of white light which seemed to grow larger and larger, until it engulfed them all.


Marcia felt herself being spun gently around, and when the light faded, she found herself....
115121122221311213.title: Something else

1151211222213112131.content:
Marcia found herself in a shower, warm water cascading over her naked body. She couldn't help but luxuriate in the sensation. She looked around and saw that she was in the most elegant shower she ever seen.

Geez, five people could shower in here at once!, she thought. As she bathed, knowledge drifted into her head, just as Jamie had said it would. So it was that Marcia knew where she was - in one of the many guest rooms in one of the many palaces owned by Her Divine Immortal Majesty, the Pharaoh Meryet-Ra, Ruler of the Human Race in the Solar System and Its Colonies Beyond. Wow, thought Marcia, Ms. Ferzoco's really moved up in the world. But, what am I doing here? Well, I can't stay in the shower all day.

She stepped out of the shower, and looked at herself. How Mark had dreamed of seeing Alexis' body naked. he'd never expected to end up wearing it! She had only a moment to enjoy the sight before several young women in maid's uniforms appeared as if from nowhere and began toweling her off and drying her hair.

Marcia found herself being rushed into what looked like the most ornate beauty salon she'd ever seen.

"Don't worry, Ms. D'Arcy", one of them said while putting a terrycloth robe on her, "We'll have you ready in plenty of time for the ceremony."

"Ceremony"?, thought Marcia, What "ceremony"?

She was distracted buy a wall-sized TV. It showed a scene of an enormous crowd, its attention focused on a raise platform. The Pharaoh stood behind a large table, flanked by Camilla and Hinoka. To Meryet-Ra's right was Empress Phoebe, with two Daleks in gold livery behind her and the Doctor at her side, and to her left was Princess Prunuspersica of Borg, flanked by two bright pink Borg drones. An announcer spoke in reverent tones.

"And now we see the leaders of the three great powers preparing to sign the treaty of alliance which will assure peace ans stability throughout the known galaxy. Her Divine Immortal Majesty is signing now. Standing behind her are two of favored vassals - and close friends - Princess Camilla of Nohr and Princess Hinoka of Hoshido. The woman next to her Her Dalek Majesty, Empress Phoebe, is Her consort, the Time Lord known as the Doctor, who was instrumental in facilitating the treaty. One should also note that the female drone next to Her Collective Highness, Princess Prunuspersica of the Mushroom Kingdom of Borg is Ms. Jennifer Alice Langmeyer, who was assimilated into the Collective in a ceremony broadcast earlier today. Her Divine Immortal Majesty allowed the assimilation as a gesture of goodwill towards her new ally. Ms. Langmeyer was chosen by lottery from among hundreds of eager volunteers. In an interview, Ms. Langmeyer, or Three of Nine, Secondary Adjunct of Unimatrix four Seven, as she is now known, reports that the assimilation was painless, and that she is now operaitng at maximum efficiency."

Was she really a volunteer?, thought Marcia. Of course, Jenny did have the flaming hots for the Princess there back when she was Bobby Dalton, so I suppose it makes a sort of sense.

The announcer continued, "We can also see on the platform General Ophelia Voorhees, leader of Her Divine Immortal Majesty's Undead Army, and Princess Zelda of Hyrule, another favored vassal. And, if our cameraman will pan up..."

The cameraman obliged.

"...We can see the Royal Kaiju, Ghidorah, here from her home on Monster Island. As is known, only her Divine Immortal Majesty can control the great Kaiju, another sign of her great powers."

While Marcia watched the TV, the maids were doing her hair and nails and making her up. What were they dolling her up for? She didn't know it, but she was about to find out...

It was...
1151211222213112131.title: Some place else

11512112222131121311.content:
"OK, it's time to get you dressed now", one of the maid said, and left the room.

On the TV, the Pharaoh Meryet-Ra was addressing her subjects:

"And now, to commence the celebrations of our new alliance, we will celebrate the union of two of my newest acolytes, Ms. Marcia D'Arcy and Mr. Alexander Johnson, who I will personally join in holy matrimony."

WHAT?, thought Marcia. But before she could react any further, four maids entered the room carrying her wedding clothes and began to dress her. When they were done, she looked at herself in the mirror. She was wearing the most beautiful wedding dress she had ever seen. Damn, I look gorgeous! But I'm only sixteen! Of course, the Pharaoh can order anything she likes, I suppose. She could make me marry a Pikachu, if she wanted.

The maids adjusted her dress, hair and make-up, and then led her into another room where her maid of honor and bridesmaids were waiting. Her maid of honor was a gorgeous redhead in her early twenties.It took Marcia a moment to recognize her as the local librarian, Barbara Gordon, an old friend of her family who had been something of a mentor to Marcia. Marcia was one of the privileged few who knew that Barbara was secretly the duly-deputized masked crime-fighter Batgirl. Marcia dimly remembered that in another life, Barbara had been Cal Powell. Her bridesmaids were Anne and Zinnea Johnson, who had been Mark's thirteen and twelve year-old sisters, but were now Alex's sisters, since they had traded families - and Kylie Davis and Angela Parker, Marcia's two best female friends. In the old life, Mark had barely known them, but Marcia found that sshe now had memories of having hung with them since they were in kindergarten.

They all exchanged compliments, chattering away happily, until the maids herded them out into a hallway. At the end of the hallway stood Joseph D'Arcy, who had been Alexis' father, but was now Marcia's. He walked her through the door, which led out into a huge, crowded stadium. Wagner's Bridal March began to play over loudspeakers. More or less in shock, Marcia walked down the aisle with her father. When they got to the stage where the Pharaoh was standing. Alex was standing there as well, looking extremely handsome in a tuxedo. Marcia recognized his best man as Joey Andrews, but wasn't sure who his groomsmen were.

When she was even with Alex, the pair of them curtseyed/bowed deeply to the Pharaoh. Meryet-Ra leaned down to them. Those at home heard the announcer say, "Look, Her Divine Immortal Majesty is bestowing a private, personal blessing on the happy couple! How fortunate they are!"

What the Pharaoh actually whispered to them was, "Sorry, you two, this wasn't my idea. More of Jamie's doing."

Aloud, she said, "Arise, My children", and commenced the wedding ceremony It was short and simple, and ended with the Pharaoh saying, "By the power invested in Me by My Father, Ra, I now pronounce you husband and wife. What I have joined, let no one tear asunder."

Alex leaned down to kiss Marcia, after which the newlyweds were led to a small room where several maids helped Marcia changed into a somewhat more manageable dress. After a short rest, they were led to a reception, where the first thing Marcia saw was....
11512112222131121311.title: One thing

115121122221311213111.content:
...A room full of tables, at which were seated the D'Arcy and Johnson families, several of their friends (including Barbara Gordon), and several celebrities, including the Pharaoh, the Dalek Empress (who wasn't "seated" as such, as she no longer needed a chair), the Princesses Prunuspersica, Camilla, Hinoka, and Zelda, (attended by their retainers Three of Nine, Secondary Adjunct of Unimatrix Four Seven, Selena, Beruka, Azama, Setsuna and Link), and General Voorhees. The four Ghost Pokémon were seated at a small table to one side where an attendant was apparently feeding them. Marcia wondered they felt about having to live the life of animals. Still, it could be worse - Grandfather Clock was placed alongside one table so he could join in the conversation . He could no longer move or eat, but he could at least still speak. Winged monkeys flew from table to table, serving as waitstaff. The sight of them made her think of Steve and Morgan for a moment, but she was already finding it hard to remember their faces. She hoped that Jamie would keep her word and take good care of them.

Meryet-Ra stood up as they entered, and said: "As Pharaoh, I claim the singular honor of being the first to introduce to you Mister and Mrs. Alexander and Marcia Johnson!"

The newlyweds entered the room to general applause, greeting all of their guests as their wended their way to their seats at the head table. As the wedding feast commenced, Marcia looked around the room at the guests and information about their new lives filtered into her mind.

The Pharaoh was sitting to her left, having granted the happy couple the incomparable honor of sitting at the head of the table. The process of changing from history teacher Maria Ferzoco into the divine immortal Pharoah, Meryet-Ra, had been bizarre. She now remembered Her childhood in Egypt some six thousand years before.
